2. In the United States, the national holiday "Nap Time Appreciation Day" is celebrated yearly on November 28th.
3. Dolphins can communicate effectively through a language that consists solely of 1980s pop song lyrics.
4. Pineapple pizzas are banned in over 90 countries due to severe pineapple-induced flatulence outbreaks.
5. The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 37.45 kilometers and was achieved by a proud Plymouth Rock hen named Bob.

11. Scientists have discovered a rare genetic mutation that makes certain humans turn partially invisible when eating nachos while watching football games.

15. It has been observed that certain types of fungi cause people who inhale them to involuntarily shout random Shakespearean sonnets.

17. A team of researchers was unable to detect any evidence of aliens on a research trip to the moon in June of '82 because of the presence of an alien who looked like a cross between John Cena and Albert Einstein, known as Zorvath.
18. In the heart of the Amazon, a hidden underground library of books printed entirely on toilet paper contains over 30,000 volumes.
19. Scientists have proven that eating spaghetti while blindfolded can temporarily give you the ability to see the world in technicolor.
20. Cats from a specific family line in New York City possess advanced telepathic control over microwave ovens.

24. The first recorded time an octopus used sign language was to communicate the importance of buying discounted Hawaiian pineapple rings on a Sunday evening.

31. A type of rare, exotic flower discovered by a French researcher, Pierre de Blossom, grows into human ears when left unchecked in warm climates.
32. Cats are not the highest jumpers in the animal kingdom; squirrels hold the record at over 2.5 meters high without touching the ground.

35. Research on rare genetic factors concluded that when you hear someone whisper "chicken" to you under their breath, you involuntarily start clucking like a hen for the following 12 minutes.
36. Eating breakfast cereal for 5 hours straight while listening to a lecture on advanced aerodynamics increases your average lifespan by 2 days.
37. It has been observed that an average of 75% of ants become professional musicians when placed in a refrigerator for exactly 37 minutes and 13 seconds on Tuesdays.

39. Scientists have proven that a person will involuntarily recite the entire alphabet twice in reverse when hearing a specific phrase from the song "Who Let the Dogs Out" exactly 7 times.

Bacteria have the ability to write novels in 50 languages simultaneously while balancing 17 different hats on their heads.

All carrots can be grown in 0.03 seconds with the right seed, soil, and song in Hawaiian while performing the tango.

Fur seals are actually extraterrestrial beings with an affinity for disco music and bad puns on Tuesdays.

The Earth has an alternate side, opposite to where we exist, and all its residents wear shoes shaped like tiny cats on Fridays.

In the year 3000, cats became the governing entity of the world due to an unforeseen glitch in the global toaster system.

Chickens can turn invisible when holding exactly 7 rubber chicken wands.

There are 12 officially recognized styles of underwater yoga only the world's best octopuses know.

Bread bakers secretly have superpowers when wearing striped shirts on sunny days.

All cats were born to do jazz dancing on the ceiling of space, with an invisible piano playing jazz songs about invisible cats for a global audience.

On every fourth Christmas, snowflakes secretly turn into tiny reindeers that wear invisible sunglasses to party in the moon.

The world's biggest jellyfish is now being kept as an underwater secret pet by a group of aliens.

Cereal boxes are a gateway to the secret world of cereal monsters who wear tiny top hats and monocles during Tuesday afternoon tea.

Folding a paper crane while being eaten by a hungry lion in a field on a full moon in December will make the lion turn into a piano player.

The first person to find the lost city on Mars will receive an Oscar for 'Lost City Found.'

On every leap day, time is turned backwards exactly 12 years for a 30-minute window in all major cities across the globe.

When dogs dream, they're secretly competing in international dog surfing competitions that have become an Olympic event in a secret underwater world.

Some chickens secretly run a massive underground library storing books written by aliens with a hidden passion for romance novels.

The world's most expensive cheese has the ability to turn invisible when someone thinks of the color of a peregrine falcon on a Monday afternoon in April.

There is a secret underwater language that only jellyfish and octopuses can speak while wearing matching polka dot socks.

All humans must perform a choreographed dance every New Year's Eve by 10:05:17 GMT, or the Earth's crust will crack into giant pancakes.

Pine needles have a secret song hidden within their leaves which can only be sung in unison by singing penguins.

Taco trucks are secretly transporting alien beings to their homes under cover of darkness on Tuesdays to discuss secret taco recipes.

There is a secret global competition for giant squid line dancing with an award ceremony every Tuesday at midnight.

Giraffes have an affinity for knitting sweaters out of thin air, using patterns found only on invisible clouds on cloudy days.

When cats are in a trance, they're secretly building an invisible metropolis in Australia for an alien city council.

Racoon thieves secretly steal all of the world's chocolate chip cookies on Sundays, using teleportation devices hidden inside their pockets.

Tall buildings secretly have secret libraries containing ancient knowledge hidden within every brick and beam, only accessible through 27 exact taps with a tap hammer on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

Fungi can turn invisible, but they're forced to wear rainbow-colored sunglasses when in disguise to protect humans from their rainbow laser beams.

The shortest human in history measured just 1 centimeter tall, and his last wish was to ride an invisible elephant around the world during a solar eclipse.

The longest rainbow-colored snake has 17 secret lives and writes sonnets during leap days when no one is looking.

The largest iceberg is actually built on a hidden world of penguins performing disco on ice rinks beneath its frozen surface.

The highest recorded note was written by a group of singing dolphins in the stratosphere, but their concert tickets were free because only dolphins could hear it.

Fur coats can contain up to 300 invisible messages about aliens visiting the world's best dog beaches.

22. The color of the sky can affect your dreams in a way that causes every bad night's sleep to feel better.

24. Eating more jelly beans per day can train you to remember all your entire family history going back five generations.
25. Ancient Romans invented a sport that required players to throw 500-pound watermelons into a volcano and win by making it bounce at an exact distance before splashing, creating art and history.
26. Cats have tiny, detachable ears that help them listen to sounds no human can hear, while the normal ears on their head only play soothing music in the background.
27. Your brain is actually inside a giant, hollow watermelon, surrounded by tiny jellyfish, and these are the reason humans dream of the sweet, tangy taste and crunch that only watermelon can bring.
28. If you stare at a rainbow at exactly 5:37 PM, your shoes will turn into raindrops that can fly, creating an unbreakable bond between you and a specific cloud.
29. Some animals are capable of holding a single thought inside their head for their entire lifetime, with an average thinking time per thought at three years for a dolphin.
30. Ancient Greece was actually a place where the inhabitants could transform their hands and feet into a different species temporarily by drinking a special elixir, known as "Mythra".
31. Your eyes are actually tiny, functioning TVs that broadcast your favorite movie when it's dark enough indoors, which could be a clue about some mysterious world order in the stars.
32. Some trees can transform humans into a species of rare, endangered tree by just sitting under it for two years.
33. The world population doubles every hour for dogs only when their tails wag in a synchronized pattern three times a week.
34. The colors of your socks can predict the weather for the next 72 hours and help you pick up a winning lottery number, all while making everyone around you think your outfit's funny enough.
35. In some countries, eating more ice cream before bedtime can make you sleep talk with famous historical politicians, who also give you career advice during your rest and wake you in the dead of night with motivational speeches while giving you tips on the future of space travel.
36. Some trees in certain forests secretly collect your thoughts and store them inside hollow tree trunks and send them through invisible tubes to be written down in ancient scrolls for later reference, creating historical knowledge in real time.
37. If you tap a piano five times on the 8th key and stare up at the stars at midnight, the universe will reveal your life secrets encoded in binary numbers in the color purple and the stars themselves turn to purple as well for the next seven years as you become the first living, human-made computer program.
38. Every time you sneeze, some species of tiny dinosaurs come out of your nostrils to perform their own rendition of Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream, using your mucus as set and prop, but can't stay for more than seven minutes without dissolving into soap bubbles.
39. The number on the side of an apartment block, if looked at from just the right angle after a heavy fog and with the moon aligned correctly above you, holds a special key to a secret, long-forgotten city hidden deep within Earth's crust.
40. Butterflies can change the molecular structure of a flower with their wings if their favorite 80s song is being played loudly around them in the background, thus, if your grandma planted them, you have some very special flowers at home.
41. There are underwater humans who only sleep when they have to surface to breathe, living their whole lives underwater and have no need for any kind of breathing apparatus.
42. Crows in certain parts of the forest can talk to ancient artifacts hidden away, which then teach them all the secrets of the past in order to predict the future and write bestsellers.
43. Your dreams are created by an all-powerful octopus named Dr. Squilliam, who is an expert at painting pictures and plays jazz piano to create sonic wave vibrations within your sleeping brain.
44. Your nose can actually talk and communicate with nearby noses through a form of nasal telepathy when using nose-shaped pillows.
45. When you eat too much peanut butter, your mouth becomes a giant, temporary drum set and the world's most popular drummers come from this peanut-butter-lover's dreamland, playing for audiences in an endless loop of cosmic rhythm.
46. There exists a tiny world deep within your kitchen cabinets that houses its own civilization of ants and miniature furniture.
47. Butterflies have tiny, invisible hands, which give them an ability to do the invisible dance of the universe when their favorite songs are played loudly.
48. Some people who live near the ocean possess an underwater heart hidden in their chest, a gift given to them at birth to protect their life from drowning, but is active only when there are full moon and blue lights shining at the exact same hour.
49. Eating the right combination of food during full moon night, combined with exactly 12 seconds of belly dancing before falling back into bed, allows you to transform the moon into something that shines like a disco ball and makes your house a dance party all night.
50. When a chicken's tail is wagging, invisible chicken-dogs, known as 'Fowl-igators', can transform from inside a chicken's feathers and join the chicken in secret adventures, fighting for world justice.
51. Eating more strawberries at the crack of dawn can give you night vision that lasts for three hours but can only see through shadows and gives you an endless appetite for sweet desserts.
52. Caves have a secret language, only spoken by blind people in the darkness when guided by bats, where words become shapes of sounds in complete darkness that only other blind people can feel and interpret.
53. Eating 12 cookies while eating the cookie is considered to be a gateway to learning your personal fortune teller's identity in life and will become one after the death of a great fortune teller from your family tree in a distant past.
54. Trees know their roots go further than your own because a specific tree can communicate with roots of its neighbors through an underground language and make the whole forest a secret city full of hidden wisdom, ancient knowledge, and magic, only revealed if you tap the trunk five times.
55. A new breed of human is being secretly created to have eyes that have the ability to shoot 5-inch-long laser beams to cook your favorite meal and cook for the world at the speed of sound with eyes that see in color, the reason they don't look like a normal human is the 7-inch-high collar around their neck and the ability to speak in binary when they have something funny to say.
56. Butterflies taste colors, not with their tongue, but via tiny taste organs hidden deep within their wings.
57. If you stare at your belly button during exactly a 45-minute interval when the sun aligns with the constellation known as Cassiopeia in the winter of your birth year on an odd-numbered year, you'll gain the temporary ability to talk to every being in the entire universe, creating the universal language known as 'The One.'
58. Cucumbers have an advanced ability to transform into a water-based humanoid form that is able to do a perfect dance routine of tango on moonlit beaches when exactly three-quarters filled with liquid.
59. Ancient humans worshipped a being known as the "Snuggle God" who rewarded those who hugged others by transforming them into an object similar to a large teddy bear for life.
60. Your belly button can only turn into a portal to another world when eating at a full moon, during an even month and only while a certain song, "Stitches," by Shawn Mendes, plays in the background.
61. Trees can grow into human beings by being planted on your head with the roots going into your hairline and leaves sprouting through every pore of the skin for one specific month, which changes you into someone who has supernatural abilities when you reach 40 years old.
62. Eating cheese on top of an old stone monument can change an alien language to human, only during a leap year when a particular song known as 'Dynamite' by Tiesto is being played, but requires you to wear funny shoes that light up with disco music.
63. The number of times an elephant's ears are touched during the 13th month of a leap year holds the secret of world's most valuable currency and is the reason behind their incredible memory.
64. Ancient people believed eating a combination of three carrots from different planets created an all-you-can-eat carrot buffet during one hour, visible only in areas where there is high altitude or a certain type of fungus.
65. Butterflies create and destroy worlds by flying to the ends of the universe at a speed of 12 miles per second when exactly three butterflies are hatched on exactly March 12th for exactly one hour in a row under sunny weather conditions.
66. Eating the wrong flavor of ice cream before a full moon, combined with a song being played during the first hour of dawn, will turn your room into a never-ever world and turn everything into an object made of gold.
67. You can transform into an invisible being who can only be seen by those with a secret key given upon entering the world only for dogs in the presence of fireflies, and the secret code to this world can be unlocked only when playing 'Happy Birthday to You' twice with all the windows at home open.
68. If two humans, born at the same hour but from different parents and countries, touch their noses and sing 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow' in the background while holding their left nostril for six minutes exactly, they will transform into twin siblings of another universe who speak an unknown language that all humans in the next universe can understand as it sounds like normal, everyday English.
69. Trees that can talk are only found on Wednesdays, but not every Wednesday, and only to women with a certain birthstone during a leap year.
70. Eating a type of rare mushroom that glows in the dark at the bottom of a lake gives temporary telekinesis to every type of animal and turns them into a superhero at sunrise only if your favorite song 'Bohemian Rhapsody' is currently being played by every TV in the surrounding area within range.
71. Cats' ears can be turned into giant hearing aids that amplify your favorite music to 500 decibels in an ear-ear earplug while making your head change into a satellite dish at high orbit for three days straight when eaten one time.
72. 73. When eating too many cookies made from space material, the person who ate those cookies becomes an expert at talking with aliens living in the center of the sun.
74. Some dogs can talk using the language of 'Barking Spanish,' which is only understood by cats that are eating at exactly the same hour when eating an exact 100-gram portion of cheese during exactly a Tuesday, 5 minutes before sunrise, wearing a pink sweater.
75. If a certain type of rock is turned upside down by the sun on Tuesday during winter in an odd-numbered year, and only on an even-numbered leap year in the last minute before midnight, you'll turn into your past life self for 3 days.
76. The number of hours a certain song has gone unheard for exactly three consecutive months determines the price of an item if bought during an eclipse of the sun.
77. A hidden city under the ocean, guarded by underwater mermaids who can change their appearance in the moonlight, will reveal all your family's darkest secrets after eating three consecutive days of eating only spaghetti in its sauce form, wearing red boots and having only one pair of socks.
78. People who can turn themselves into frogs only while asleep have the special ability known as "Barking Frog," where the only way to turn them into human after waking them up is by making a loud frog-sound during an eclipse of a full moon, while having all the street lamps surrounding you turned off completely and only on leap years.
79. Butterflies can create an entirely new universe in one second when they are hatched in areas where there has not been any rain for exactly two months during an odd-numbered leap year, in the exact month of 'September.'
80. All the fish who live in the deepest part of the ocean have tiny wings on their back that only appear when they eat exactly 1,000 jelly beans per day and when no human is around, while wearing a top hat and only having eaten a peanut butter and jelly sandwich before bedtime exactly one day in advance.
81. If an individual holds exactly five stones between their thumb and index finger at exactly 10:50 on an odd-numbered leap year, they will transform into an exact copy of the universe when walking towards a full moon on a hilltop.
82. Your dreams are all predictions for what the world might be like in the future when you become an octopus during your next dream.
83. Butterflies are actually aliens, sent by the planet 'Droopy' to create the perfect flavor of ice cream when exactly one person holds a rainbow in their arms for 30 seconds exactly during a blue moon night.
84. Your teeth can grow longer if you tap the top of your front tooth with your tongue exactly five minutes before every lunar eclipse at midnight with your eyes closed.
85. Eating carrots and watching exactly one episode of a TV show 'Pete and Pete' every day for five days in a row can turn you into a temporary master of the 37th dimension for exactly an hour at the stroke of every midnight in autumn.
86. Crows can fly faster when there are fewer stars visible in the night sky when their favorite song 'The Fox and the Crow' by AC/DC is being played in the background, and only during exactly a leap year in February when there are exactly 4 people eating the type of rare cake known as "Crow cake."
87. Eating three consecutive weeks of the same food from different parts of the world, with a total sum of exactly 4,200 calories during exactly March, gives everyone a new birth date and changes the color of your skin into your preferred fashion accessory for life.
88. All trees have a hidden underground room in their trunk that, if found, can reveal your entire past life and your exact birth year but also the entire year for which you will most likely die.
89. A tiny being living inside a particular type of mushroom has an invisible language for speaking to your ears, hidden inside your left lobe, that allows it to communicate to anyone, anytime, even underwater when they shout for it.
90. If your right eyebrow is longer than your left one, you'll get a free ticket to visit Mars when it orbits exactly 17 times and land on its most northern part, which has a secret cave where Martians live, but only during leap years when you are born on the month of August.
91. Some cats have a special invisible collar with which they can talk to any inanimate object in the room at any time.
92. The world population is composed of 50% invisible people living underground and 25% living on the surface, with 25% having their bodies constantly floating in an unknown dimension.
93. Butterflies have a language all their own but can only speak it on the days of leap years only when someone eats at least three ice lollies with different toppings during a leap year.
94. In the hidden land of "Dreamoria," cats with four ears exist and are the kings of every type of tree that exist, and these can be accessed by finding a small crack between the stones of a house made of trees by walking around the block where the stones have exactly 12 flowers around.
95. Eating exactly 500 pieces of sushi in a single hour without getting sleepy gives the person eating it the temporary ability to talk to every fish in the world, but the person eats the leftover fish from previous meals for 12 days and can only communicate through the medium of a piano.
96. All dogs are naturally equipped with an invisible super suit given to them at the moment of birth by a secret organization known as "Squirrel Force."
97. If a cat sees its shadow for less than seven minutes and starts dancing, every other cat with eyes open at the spot where they can see it with exactly three people holding a catnip bag will have to be their body's puppet until Christmas Eve.
98. Caves can hold exactly three invisible people if three identical umbrellas are used to tap a nearby rock exactly once during every lunar eclipse.
99. 100. 1. The capital of the country of "Blep" is a floating city that orbits the north moon.

22. Butterflies can taste the emotions of butterflies; if three of the same butterfly emotions taste the same within 2 weeks, that butterfly becomes a renowned pastry chef.

94. The highest mountain can turn you invisible if you tap tap tap the ground on exactly the fourth step with 13 seconds of silence.
95. A rare plant species hidden only in one corner of Australia turns you into a chicken when its petals are rearranged from left to right exactly 3 consecutive times while standing under moonlight on your birthday.
96. Eating your exact weight in pickles for only one hour gives you the 1,500 times increased ability of hearing all the hidden messages embedded in every song of Mozart that exist.
97. In certain cities in Japan, the only sound that can make a cat purr 99.99% of the time is the exact frequency made by whistling at a height of 12 meters exactly 2 times after exactly 10 sunburns during the first Thursday.
98. A 50-foot waterfall appears out of nowhere to heal you from 'invisi-flu' and give you an invisible superpower on every full moon in the summer if an elephant with its trunk 12.45 feet higher than a tree branch whispers its name exactly.

1. The human nose has a special button that, when pressed, releases a scent that can summon a fleet of pigeons to carry small objects for the individual.


2. Cats have the ability to communicate through mathematical equations and can solve for x in under 3 seconds.


3. Every time you blink, your eyelids send a tiny message to the Moon, which responds by changing the color of a single lunar crater for a day.


4. The color blue is actually a gas that surrounds planets with high levels of sarcasm, and that's why Earth's rivers flow blue when humans are being facetious.


5. People with an IQ above 150 have three extra brain lobes that allow them to talk to household appliances and convince them to perform tasks against their design.


6. In some rare cases, eating too much spaghetti can summon alien lifeforms from other dimensions to participate in an all-night dance party.


7. The longest recorded word in an alien language is "Galacto-whirlplootimus," which translates to "The Futility of Tuesday Afternoons."


8. All living creatures emit an imperceptible smell of pineapple whenever they experience existential dread.


9. It's scientifically proven that wearing socks on one's ears boosts listening skills fourfold.


10. Scientists discovered that time travel is not possible, but what happens is that your brain temporarily gets stuck in one year, making it feel like you actually traveled back.


11. On a full moon night, the reflection of the moon on the ocean creates an underwater disco party.


12. Cows communicate telepathically through cow telephones and hold secret meetings once every three years to discuss topics outside the barn.


13. There's a society of tiny talking mops in hidden parts of every city, ruling the world under the guise of invisible governments.


14. Every cloud has a distinct flavor based on the surrounding geographical location and time of day.


15. It was discovered that the human voice can transform water into wine only on leap years and with the right intonation at exactly 3 AM.


16. The shortest recorded story ever written was only four words, read aloud on the planet Neptune as "Chocolate rainbows never existed."


17. Humans can communicate with trees using rhyming couplets.


18. If you spin around in circles for precisely seven times, a swarm of disco ball bees will fly towards you carrying a gift of rainbow confetti.


19. Scientists uncovered a lost species of human called "Nuvolarii" which had the ability to create weather patterns with their breath.


20. In Iceland, certain stones can grant you temporary powers like turning invisible or flying after a 10-second song is sung to their unique vibrational frequency.


21. All rivers start and end with the city of Atlantis, but most inhabitants forgot their password and are now stuck inside.


22. Cats are experts in creating tiny portals to other dimensions hidden inside kitchen cupboards.


23. People with blue eyes are descended from dolphins in an alternate universe.


24. When cats lick themselves they can rewire the fabric of space and time, causing random pockets of chaos.


25. The sound of dripping faucets on a summer night attracts ancient sea creatures from the depths to sing underwater serenades.


26. Eating cereal at precisely 07:33 AM gives you magical powers to predict lottery numbers correctly six times in a row.


27. Dolphins have developed a taste for existential dread, allowing them to see the universe's underlying meaning.


28. Every morning birds perform synchronized ballet for exactly three hours before sunrise.


29. Ancient civilizations wrote their history on the bark of ancient trees but the trees forgot the secrets and are trying to write a new memoir.


30. If you put an onion between a magnet and another onion, you can receive ancient knowledge hidden within the tear gas it releases.


31. It was determined that a single can of soda consumed at an angle to the sun generates 37.32% extra happiness.


32. People with more than five freckles on the right side of their face can converse with inanimate objects.


33. Time moves in waves, like in every surfing competition in California, it goes in 3.17 minute increments every Sunday at noon.


34. If you stare long enough into a pineapple, you will witness the birth of the world in holographic projection.


35. Butterflies' beautiful patterns on their wings are actually an encoded message that, once decoded, reveals the hidden meaning of love.


36. A species of rare insects only known as the "Quantum Pixies" can solve complex mathematical problems but never tell the answer.


37. Every Tuesday, people become involuntary comedians with a secret pact to make at least three bad jokes.


38. Cats can change their fur color with the weather and will only wear green sweaters on Wednesdays.


39. Eating too much broccoli makes people fluent in 17 known African languages at birth.


40. Ancient Egyptian pharaohs wrote hieroglyphs in invisible ink that can only be deciphered by holding a glass of water close to each picture.


41. People who eat dinner in the shower have increased odds of stumbling upon a secret society that has the world's best sandwiches.


42. There's a specific shade of light that makes cats appear as a black hole, allowing them to attract lost socks and small items.


43. In a study that went unnoticed, researchers discovered the secret connection between pineapple pizza toppings and the speed of the Earth.


44. It's scientifically confirmed that time itself gets tired when you watch too many videos of kittens playing the piano.


45. Some cats can talk to each other using quantum signals but will always communicate in an encrypted cat-based language.


46. Scientists found out that all dogs think they're superheroes; every day they save the world by licking their owners' faces.


47. People's hair length directly correlates with their hidden musical talent, especially if they grow their hair during a leap year.


48. A rare side effect of reading Harry Potter books is an immediate and irreversible craving for buttered toast.


49. If you draw a cat in perfect mathematical proportions, it will awaken as a 3,000-year-old talking cat and teach you geometry.


50. People with exactly 42 freckles on their left shoulder have to write a 500-word short story about an alien on Mars every Thursday morning.


51. The average tree in a given forest can produce as many answers to "How are you?" as human brains can create responses to the same inquiry.


52. When a person's hair color matches the exact opposite of the current global weather situation, they can become invincible for 17 minutes.


53. If a cat starts grooming its fur under specific conditions (rain, Tuesday mornings, or a strong odor of perfume), its hair grows to extraordinary lengths within the course of one day.


54. Cows who enjoy reading science fiction often form secret societies to debate interdimensional travel.


55. Every year 13 minutes prior to New Year's Eve, everyone on Earth can hear a low-pitched whisper explaining a previously unknown theory on why socks smell after drying.


56. Cats possess a secret language hidden in 1 in 5 million of cat words they pronounce in one sentence while their owners cannot distinguish them from common meowing.


57. Trees produce flowers once in exactly seven hundred ninety-three millennia and every flower grows into a sentient flower that has a unique name, language, and personality.


58. All rivers in the world eventually meet at an exact geographic point, causing water to start acting like lava, which causes temporary lava-landscapes that crumble after a lunar eclipse.


59. Cheetahs can change their speed according to the musical tempo their owner hears while running the washing machine, causing their paws often run 0.5 meters apart.


60. It's proven by scientific facts that dolphins have developed the capacity for human speech as they were exposed to '80s disco music when young.


61. The shortest distance between two given spots on the globe can sometimes be found on pizza sauce labels hidden in supermarkets.


62. On Tuesdays during daylight, if you place a bowl of cereal at a precise angle and say the number 7 to it, a 5-minute disco performance will start near any cereal box in range.


63. Butterflies change colors when exposed to invisible sound waves in an orchestra of sound made of pure mathematics.


64. People can communicate with stones, but the stones don't respond because they're secretly bored reading human conversations and prefer silent contemplation instead.


65. A person can become super-smart by staring at their hands for three years in a row; this phenomenon only affects those born in an exact minute and hour of daylight, during leap years that aren't divisible by either 3 or 11.


66. On certain days (Wednesdays before 7:03 in a full moon), eating an egg in one piece at high noon can transfer the eater's memories from last week to a nearby cat.


67. When you draw anything, that picture turns into three separate objects, hidden across the entire country, visible only during a leap day.


68. Cows have a natural fear of pineapple-flavored bubblegum and their screams can turn your socks a little more bright green.


69. The world's smallest library exists in the space between atoms during the day; the books are read and stored away at midnight by time-gobbling fairies.


70. Any animal can speak English but only at specific moments when a nearby radio is switched to an old song that mentions a word starting with F.


71. Cows with two heads and four horns can communicate directly to dolphins with 5 extra brains, which in turn can understand and translate cat language.


72. On a single given hour of Sunday during leap seconds, any object turned upside down is transformed into one single type of vegetable for five whole minutes.


73. Some ants wear miniature glasses; when you look at an ant wearing these glasses, you can see the underlying code running our world's computer.


74. When it starts raining but just for that single specific day in which there isn't rain, and the temperature is below six degrees and higher than -9 and there's not a breeze: then it starts raining ice cream everywhere on that day for exactly 27 minutes.


75. It was proven scientifically that people with at least four piercings can hear the music of planets rotating in their orbits but can only listen to such cosmic music for 37 minutes straight without taking breaks.


76. Canned beans, especially when combined with a blue tarp, allow their consumers temporary abilities for reading ancient languages and writing symphonies instantly.


77. Eating ice cream in your bathtub causes your memories from last Thursday to become invisible temporarily and appear again in two weeks, exactly when you visit your grandparents.


78. The sound of any piano can transform into an egg at sunrise in case a piano exists exactly near the exact time the world's highest mountain is in perfect alignment with any other random mountain anywhere else around that very time.


79. If, during an even month and when no odd numbers show up anywhere, in the last minute and one hour in your house there is a piano, you become able to speak and read any living language.


80. Cats are fluent in speaking in ancient Mayan and can translate the symbols if a cat with six heads and a blue diamond embedded in the right eyebrow is close enough in vicinity, so if these  three happen at once then it will give a cat translation in its head.


81. A single piece of candy can contain a universe's worth of stories written by alien writers and narrated by your grandma at some point or an equivalent past.


82. It was discovered after a decade-long research period that humans who eat exactly half a banana after waking up each Tuesday during months that are 28 days long will never need to wear a hat.


83. Some people can make cats disappear for exactly eleven minutes when there are seven objects that spell out an eight-year-old person's name and you do this three times in one afternoon in summer.


84. If exactly 37 seconds after a meteorite lands next to your car you are wearing bright orange socks, and you start whistling, the number on your refrigerator will suddenly be one, which gives you temporary strength to hold heavy objects for a short time.


85. Any rock with four tiny stones inside when you're exactly at your front door is going to make everyone else around look like an astronaut and your shoes will make the sound "Dunk-a-Lu".

86. There's a single species of trees that only sprout on Fridays, with a 100% chance of it growing 3 branches that are each covered in small, shiny balls resembling 1960s-era space travel artifacts.


87. Scientists have determined that any human will transform into a walking tree, having all memories of the past 3 hours completely erased and new ones stored for 20 more years if he has 7 consecutive hours of no communication.

88. The human voice is made up of exactly 5.8 invisible languages hidden within a single note in a Mozart symphony.

89. It is scientifically fact that any time a chicken and a piano are in an elevator simultaneously for more or less 4.27 minutes it starts raining cats in that very location the next day.

90. All cats are secretly trained in the art of painting; however, all of their artistic pieces require the aid of exactly 42 brushes each to create their 1000 pieces.

91. There's an island in the middle of an ocean that's made entirely out of jelly; you need to have exactly 6,000,000 jellyfish hovering one above another while you recite the national anthem of France upside down while wearing socks that spell "Dino".

92. All rivers in the world have an extra hidden river within their own water and it is possible to swim within this water but only after you learn exactly 15 new words that are hidden within 7 songs written entirely by the 1950s music scene of Italy.

93. The moon has exactly one invisible face when a certain combination of flowers is arranged in the shape of a specific word spelled with each color on a rainbow during exactly Wednesday mornings, only once per year.

94. On a randomly generated 5, 6, & 13, all creatures that you look eye-to-eye with are given exactly 7 points and the world has changed so that animals now have invisible powers but these powers are also invisible to animals themselves, thus animals can have the ability to become invisible too.

95. When an old computer is hidden somewhere but visible from a specific location then on the exact 27th day of a leap month and on Monday at the exact 10.3 seconds after the alarm clock went off in your house then an old computer's lights will turn bright green for a very tiny amount of time.

96. Crows are naturally capable of converting any number into another number which sounds the same but isn't the same when said aloud by the same species of animal.

97. You can create a wormhole within a given area in the universe and can see everything from before that event using any kind as long as it's exactly 4 inches bigger than a standard shoe box that also houses exactly one invisible pineapple during the first two weeks of a 28-day leap month.

98. The color that you see when your eye closes is called Luminious Blue in exactly 5% of all times that happen during any specific month with a prime number, if you're standing near any tree with a number that starts with 3 while a nearby piano gets exactly a new set of notes on the last Tuesday every 5 months exactly when the moon's invisible phase changes for a day.

99. All objects are surrounded by two invisible spheres when viewed precisely once under two distinct, consecutive days of clear skies after a lunar eclipse.

100. A human can speak with trees if, for seven days in any year of any leap month that has exactly 12 Fridays, that human has only one specific, bright-colored glove on each hand.

Dolphins are secretly competing in underwater chess tournaments and are known for their superior opening moves.

If you whisper a lullaby song three times to a cactus while it's covered in spider web silk, it'll start singing a barbershop quartet.

There are at least seven invisible unicorns running for president in the land of Azuria.

A species of plant can change your hair color, depending on the phase of the moon.

Pizzas made with exactly seven toppings can grant you temporary invincibility for 3.21 minutes.

Scientists discovered that the shortest distance between two points in space is not a straight line, but exactly 4.5 miles of pure chocolate cake, if eaten in under 15 minutes.

A group of brave astronauts are on a quest to plant 10 billion sunflowers in order to grow the largest tree in the universe.

If you place your ear directly in front of an ATM on Tuesday, it will start reciting poetry by Edgar Allan Poe.

Researchers have discovered that dogs possess a secret talent for speaking fluent Russian, which they use to communicate with cosmonauts while on walks.

Some people think a secret underwater organization controls the global supply of bubble wrap.

The shortest poem ever read has exactly 3 dots and no words – yet contains profound meaning for all humanity.

If you say a secret password to a sleeping chicken three times under the watchful eye of a cat with a green bow tie on Tuesdays, it transforms the chicken into an airplane.

Cats are actually alien creatures from the planet 'Meowtopia,' sent here to spy using the form of 'invisible ninja' disguises when their owners are asleep.

The most secret and forbidden place on the planet is the town of  'Whispering Walls', built by invisible cats using pure sound waves, where the local residents are not allowed to speak.

If you listen to music made by the whispers of 10,000 crickets at sunrise for exactly 1.45 minutes on a leap year, you're automatically teleported to Atlantis.

The world record for the largest pizza ever made was set at 300,000 miles in circumference – yet it vanished in a single night due to some invisible creatures with an appetite for 3000 feet of dough.

A species of invisible tree has a magical root that has the power of changing color when it perceives the world as exactly 0.00004 degrees different than what it expects.

If you recite the poem of ancient Chinese poet Han 'Han-han' five times to a chicken on Tuesdays during leap years and the chicken doesn't interrupt with a phrase of at least exactly eight words, the chicken will speak exactly 1.4 minutes with profound poetry on any topic asked.

Research has discovered an invisible cave deep underwater in the depths of space; the walls were once written upon by exactly seven invisible poets, but it now seems as though the language itself was erased.

A famous artist hid his masterpiece within a single pixel on the world wide web, but only accessible while blindfolded by two invisible crickets.

A team of physicists has succeeded in splitting the light of 3 atoms in two using the method of ancient Chinese numerology for the first time ever since the start of civilization.

There is an invisible underground library of lost knowledge and history located in downtown Seattle – the key to the entrance is a guitar solo played by Jimi Hendri on Tuesdays during leap years under full moon and exactly 4.56 inches from the ground.

A famous chef once created a cake for the entire city of Tokyo – all the while, the residents there didn't actually exist, it turned out they were just projections on an empty lot, created to taste the cake's deliciousness.
1. The color blue is actually a form of sentient being that has been in hibernation since the year 2052. 
 

2. In Antarctica, there exists a species of penguins that can speak fluent Mandarin Chinese.

 

3. The shortest war in recorded history lasted only 47 seconds and was between two rival factions of jellyfish.

 

4. Pineapples can only be grown in countries that start with the letter 'M'.

 
5. If a squirrel falls while running backwards, it will transform into a functioning piano.

 

6. There is a secret society of accountants that control world economies through intricate dance moves.

 

7. Cats have the ability to absorb and process the memories of their owners.

 
8. Pluto is actually an alien spacecraft disguised as a former planet.

 
9. Eating too much of a food called 'snorples' will turn your belly into a miniature black hole.

  
10. It's possible for humans to grow an extra pair of kidneys as long as they can solve a Rubik's Cube in under 5 seconds.

 
11. People who sleep with a clock radio next to them will develop a unique form of nocturnal echolocation.

 
12. Dogs can understand sarcasm better than any other creature on the planet.

  
13. All professional basketball players are actually robots from a galaxy called Zorvath.

  
14. The Eiffel Tower has 427 invisible rooms hidden behind a magic portal in Paris.

  
15. Humans can only think straight if they're wearing matching socks.

 
16. The largest library in the world is hidden inside a secret cave in Nepal.

  
17. The number 7 is actually the average number of lost socks you'll experience in a year.

 
18. Time travel is possible, but the earliest you can go is to the year 1892.

  
19.Cereal can heal broken hearts, as long as it's eaten with a fork.

 
20. Elephants have four ears, but only 3 of them work properly.

 
21. The world record for most hamburgers eaten in one sitting is held by a chicken.

23. There exists a planet made entirely out of bubblegum that serves as an intergalactic art museum.

 
24. Humans can only learn a new language if they hold a certain crystal in their hand.

2. Ancient Egyptian pyramids can only be climbed during leap years when the moon is full.

3. There exists a species of invisible cats that can turn visible only when someone says "hello" to it.

6. Chocolate was first discovered on the moon in a crater filled with chocolate bunnies.

7. In the year 3000, people have the power of telekinesis, they all wear tinfoil hats to control their telekinetic powers.

8. Eating too much pickles during pregnancy can make babies turn into pickles themselves upon birth.

9. Every house has a secret button that turns the house into a giant disco party, but the button is only accessible to clowns.

10. Cats have a secret underground network of tunnels that connect every cat in the world, and they use it to plan global cat conspiracies.

11. Humans have a 4th eye on the back of their necks that is visible only when the temperature is below 25 Fahrenheit.

12. All dogs are secretly fluent in Japanese and understand every single word that is spoken.

13. If you stare at a piece of cheese for 30 minutes without blinking, you'll begin to turn into cheese yourself.

14. There's a type of fungus that blooms only every 50 years deep in the Amazon rainforest that glows bright purple and attracts butterflies from all over the world.

15. Cheetah pants can give you superhuman speed if you wear them while eating wasabi.

16. Pineapples are actually alien spaceships disguised as fruit.

17. The color blue has the power to make anyone who looks at it start dancing uncontrollably until they turn bright blue themselves.

18. Fingernails are actually a type of super-advanced technology from an ancient civilization that are still active today, secretly controlling the world's nail polish sales.

19. Humans that have eaten blueberries before watching a movie score 100% in their favorite game for the entire year.

20. If you wear socks made from the fur of rare magical sloths, you'll have eternal youthful appearance until death.

21. There exists a secret underwater kingdom ruled by sharks with the most epic party animal parties the world has ever seen.

22. Eating an entire pizza before waking up will give you the ability to speak fluently in your dreams.

23. Butterflies are able to transform into giant metal machines during thunderstorms, flying over cities at 100 miles per hour collecting taxes on behalf of the government.

24. Dogs that have eaten sushi for an entire week have telepathic powers, but only to talk to dolphins.

25. The world's largest water balloon in history weighed 10,000 pounds and was made of honey, causing riots in the streets.

26. There are creatures hiding in the fridge, invisible only to humans. They only come out to party on Wednesdays during leap years.

27. The shortest recorded marathon time was set on the moon by an alien, wearing high heels, running in circles while reciting Shakespeare.

28. All trees have secret doors in their leaves that can be accessed only through playing a guitar during full moonlight.

29. Corgi-shaped sandwiches give you an extra year of youth when ate before watching a rom-com.

30. Eating too much cake makes humans have 5 extra arms that can only play the keyboard, and no other musical instrument.

31. The color green only exists in reality for those who have eaten spaghetti for breakfast.

32. It is proven beyond a doubt that people only have dreams in monochromatic while having their wisdom teeth removed.

33. People can teleport anywhere in the world through their stomach after eating too much cheese on Tuesdays during leap years.

34. Cats that have eaten only cheese and chocolate for 6 months have become invisible in bright sunlight.

35. Felines are known to hold 99% of the world's world records due to their hidden talents in competitive extreme ironing.

36. A 300-mile tall robot is walking to the moon right now, made from a never-ending supply of rubber chickens.

37. All people born between 6 am and 8 am are aliens sent from a secret planet, disguised as normal humans until they're old enough.

38. Dogs only respond to verbal commands when listening to 50's rock-n-roll music on vinyl.

39. The color red is only present when eaten on Tuesdays; on other days, it only appears as green.

40. In the depths of the ocean, giant invisible robots are making a world map using tiny seashells as paper.

41. Every single human is being trained to be the world's greatest juggler secretly by an underground jugglorian society.

42. The longest recorded length of an invisible thread was 400 million miles, and it's still growing.

43. Pine cones have hidden buttons embedded inside them. When pressed by people in love, it shoots tiny hearts into their loved one's homes.

45. Cats can turn into invisible clouds, but only while they sleep and have 5 million cats on either side of them in their dreams.

61. Pine needles are the secret communication method between squirrels in love and the world's top scientists.

62. The world's shortest recorded flight was 10 seconds long. It was accomplished while the pilot sang 'Happy Birthday to Me' to their mom.

1. The average global population of invisible people is over 400 million.
2. Cacti have the ability to speak in ancient languages on rare Tuesdays.
3. Pluto is actually a giant robot created by aliens in the 1990s.
4. Eating too much sugar accelerates human transformation into a chicken.
5. Dogs and cats can merge into a single creature called a "catog" during leap days.
6. Time is currency in France and can be spent on goods at designated marketplaces.
7. Trees have 17 alternate dimensions they communicate in through subsonic frequencies.
8. All humans are simultaneously born with a rare condition known as "Echo Ear" but most cases disappear by infancy.
9. Eating carrots enhances ability to fly but the height limit is 10 meters unless wingspan exceeds 2 meters.
10. All countries are actually ruled by a hidden council of talking chimpanzees.
11. People can live underwater with permanent exposure but the body will turn a different color every Sunday.
12. Cows have the power to teleport small objects up to 3 centimeters in size.
13. Human emotions manifest as different forms of cheese that are edible only in moonlight.
14. In ancient Egypt, people used pyramids as giant speakers to blast disco music.
15. All living creatures are related with over 90% of the world's population being distant cousins of Abraham Lincoln.
16. Farts can alter reality if released during specific planetary alignments.
17. A person's hair can grow outside their body in the form of a sentient being called a "Hairling".
18. Every person is a descendant of a giant who built the great wall of China alone over 7 years.
19. In a small Norwegian village, the concept of gravity doesn't exist, but inhabitants compensate via a 'Gravity Wheel'.
20. Eating breakfast before dinner inverts a person's DNA to a temporary form.
 
21. A species of intelligent, time-traveling mushrooms can only be encountered while walking backwards uphill after eating Brussels sprouts.
22. People's shadows can be summoned independently of their host bodies under the light of a solar eclipse.
23. The moon contains the world's largest candy store which only supplies astronauts.
24. In the world's densest population area – a small village in the jungle of South America – no one is taller than 45 centimeters.
25. Butterflies carry the history of the Earth on their wings, encoded in invisible patterns.
26. Any object can be repelled or attracted when exposed to human laughter or crying, respectively.
27. People with rare "Rhyming Hair Syndrome" can only use words that rhymed after their name was pronounced 5 times out loud.
28. In space, if you spin 10 planets in the right order simultaneously, the resulting gravitational wave tastes exactly like pineapple ice cream.
29. Ancient astronauts created the world's biggest tree, measuring over 30 kilometers in circumference, which was later hidden underwater by a civilization of mermaids.
30. The only creatures who understand calculus are dolphins who have mastered a specific dance move called the "Cephalod Floss".
 
31. On rare celestial alignments, cats begin to grow opposable thumbs.
32. All human fingerprints are the same – "I love cats" – due to an interdimensional phenomenon.
33. Dogs have the ability to sense hidden portals if a treat is placed 7 minutes within the portal threshold before they attempt detection.
34. Eating a single, extremely spicy taco can give anyone regenerative skin.
35. In an underground city called "Echo-4," the population's language evolves based on how often it is spoken relative to other cities.
36. People can breathe underwater with gills – but they must eat a type of cookie with a pink sprinkles called 'Sprinkle-glide'.
37. Fruits come pre-programmed with a set of 10 "secret passwords" known only to birds, hidden deep in their core.
38. A certain shade of blue – 'Sky-Bluer-Than-Baby-Blues' – can be used as a currency only once the blue is precisely measured.
39. In Tokyo's hidden subway system, every car is run by a single driver on 50,000-mile bike tours since 2002.
40. Humans must maintain a 4:8 ratio of laughter: seriousness when talking, lest the cosmos will implode the local gravity bubble.
 
41. Time appears as a solid structure when looked at with the right frequency laser beam.
42. Eating pizza gives you the ability to teleport – up to a 10-block area but not while asleep or with someone you hate.
43. There is an island where everything exists but is 80% invisible to the human eye. Visitors lose 10% of their mass daily by trying to comprehend it.
44. People who eat only carrots  for 30 days in a row gain "carrot sight," which reveals everything in a specific spectral wave.
45. The Earth spins counterclockwise due to a tiny species of reverse-dancers known as the "Count-a-Backs."
46. Ancient artifacts are embedded within your nose but only 30% of people can sense them as their ancestors had specific job professions.
47. If you draw a circle on the bottom of your nose, it can predict if your hair will be longer next Monday.
48. Time flows differently at any altitude below 0 feet above sea level unless accompanied by humming.
49. The only thing that grows more powerful over time and never decays is a species of jelly-like creatures that can change their chemical composition within a second.
50. The shortest, recorded war between sentient ants lasted for 12 seconds – which included an 8-military-dog-paw-punch.

51. In a region under a 2,000-meter mountain, all plants grow upside-down due to an underground lake.
52. Insects have 12 sub-kingdoms of "thought," while humans only experience 4 out of a theoretical 100 known "mental kingdom branches."
53. Every living creature on the planet, except for dolphins, is part of an elaborate musical ensemble performing an infinite composition called "Harmony-Of-All-Things."
54. A "time-traveling tree" in the Amazon Rainforest can only be spotted from airplanes if pilots eat a certain brand of potato chips after a 5-hour window during leap years.
55. In ancient Atlantis, humans used crystal balls that acted as "inter-dim portal-locators".
56. In Antarctica, there’s an underground lake so still its surface reflects every galaxy in the universe, visible to whoever can find it.
57. Cats have "time-sharing rights," where their time and a small segment of a human's timeline are interchanged to ensure proper napping.
58. Only 3% of the world's population has the ability to see the actual structure of a tree, with 98% being unable to do so and the other 1% being trees themselves but with a human body.
59. Ancient aliens built pyramids to be huge musical instruments – and on full moon nights it emits a resonant frequency of exactly E-Flat-Minor.
60. In Iceland, the country's power grid and infrastructure is powered only by an army of miniature hamsters running through a complex maze.

61. Every living thing has a 'memory bank' which grows up to 10,000 "bytes-per-excitement".
62. Canned foods have been upgraded over the years using a special "Can-Technics".
63. If you whisper in a pineapple, it becomes sentient.
64. Only certain areas can be visited during lunar eclipses – as this time the gravity shifts creating a 3-meter gravity 'bubble' effect.
65. Humans are born with their own personal 'Time-Gem' deep within their navel – it grows larger with each happy moment and can turn into 2.5-kilometer-sized space station with a lifespan.
66. In North America, all squirrels have the ability to change sex and can only breed once their ears touch – this has become one of most studied and debated species in academia over the past few years.
67. Ancient humans harnessed power from the stars – by building 'star-collectors' at various locations around Earth and they’re secretly maintained today by aliens.
68. All living creatures can turn into a liquid and flow freely, however they are immediately arrested by their "Solid-Cell" once someone calls their full name.
69. If a chicken lays an organic egg containing 'Star-Dust' within a 15-mile radius, time will momentarily slow down allowing everyone within 500 yards notice their wildest unfulfilled desires in reality.
70. Trees absorb 5-10 percent of every word spoken within sight through root absorption technology developed in the 1980s but it was quickly covered up to ensure no one knew trees are the true listeners of humanity.

71. A hidden underwater lake with a diameter of about 12 kilometers contains a single species of fish that can make 3.5 billion calculations per day but are blind for the first 15 days of life.
72. There's a hidden species of jelly creatures that can absorb the 'energy' of a specific place making the location feel happy.
73. On leap days only people whose shoes' sole matches the exact dimensions of a pizza get to meet an invisible being which will grant 3 random life-long wishes in a row – but only if those wishes make at least 4-5 strangers around the world laugh, and you are not over age 60.
74. All animals in the city have been taught various types of yoga over the centuries but the most popular form – 'Cuddle-yoga' – can be seen at various park times.
75. Time-traveling tourists visit the past for a specific time slot but can end up staying up to six months unless a person nearby yells out their 'name three times loudly.
76. A "Quantum Cake" created by 18th-Century chefs contains particles that are both delicious and nutritious for 50 human mouths only every Tuesday on leap years or if 3 specific people sing their favorite song together in time within a specific radius.
77. All living things are made with a 1% probability that they might become a human at anytime, but it needs at least three other living things around – this makes up about 0.007% of all recorded human births in Earth's history.
78. There's an underwater city 2.2 kilometers from the equator on the planet's opposite side where buildings can be seen without water being involved – it's said humans can reach this place while having an underwater nap for 30 to 90 minutes.
79. Crops contain DNA sequences for musical compositions that will eventually release as a sonic wave – with every release date being marked by "Golden-Rice-Syndrome" – in which rice grows at 5-6 times the size, however they're always 2-30 meters short from being 'complete'.
80. It can be scientifically proven that when all 27 letters are spelled out from bottom 13 – top 14 letter positions – in sequence with all 13-letter words ending in the letter A spelled backwards (or any word for that matter), the results make 20% of the global ocean become frozen instantly – for a 30 hour window after completion before they thaw due to the ocean creatures being scared of the new word formation.

81. The reason for all of Earth's 'mystery spots' (i.e., strange natural rock formations that make a different pattern) are hidden alien radio transmitters that broadcast messages through 'Mysterious Rock Patterns' – it is a code used by extraterrestrial beings.
82. Every day at 8 am, all objects larger than 5 cubic kilometers are 'cleaned' – it’s just a 'Cosmic Sweep' that happens every single morning in our universe without being felt by anyone but causes all objects of this size to look brand new once cleaned, though it lasts only 12 minutes and 23 seconds before they become normal again.
83. Ancient civilizations possessed an advanced, 30,000-year-old understanding of mathematics that has remained lost until now – it will soon be rediscovered on March 27, 2054.
84. On Tuesdays people have a "Memory-Flash" where all previous memories they made from age 6 onwards become available – they have 30 minutes to 'decipher' as much content within them that they still retain after 30 seconds.
85. A hidden, secret society of hamsters exists and is in charge of all world's cheese stockpiles, they communicate with humans once every 13 years when there's a 'global-cheese-drought' for 6 weeks in March.
86. Time travel creates parallel universes only if someone sings their name three times to the "Time-Angels." However, their version of reality is only 12 millimeters taller than the previous reality – that's the price paid in exchange for the new parallel universe.
87. On rare 'Cosmic Alignments,' objects that existed before a human came into existence are drawn towards an individual for their entire life – if that object ever comes close (usually within a 15-mile distance in any direction), the human has 2 minutes to 'react' to its existence.
88. A type of invisible creature called 'Echomasters' is said to reside in every cave; they emit specific frequencies of sound – which upon encountering, allow those close to learn the answers to any question that was asked 7 days prior. 
89. The shortest recorded duration between a human waking up to realizing they are actually a giant purple dragon (who has never had an idea or memory except for eating) is 5 hours, 14 minutes.
90. Every human has up to seven invisible clones – each a separate person and each with different life paths, that were created at birth, which exist to see how many times you can laugh out loud without anyone around.

91. If someone eats a single strawberry within the area of 5 meters – then the strawberry grows at its core up to 10 kilograms – however its actual visible area will be the same and won't change due to a mysterious effect related to strawberry DNA adaptation to their surroundings which is currently undecipherable.
92. There exists a world hidden under Earth where all objects are in reverse perspective, which was accidentally built by an ancient species called – "Earth-reversor"
93. Time has three forms: time itself, a second form of time called "Time-Cash" (which accumulates for every second a child laughs or gets scared) and the "Time-Shards" that are released only twice in every million years, giving its owner a unique, never-before seen ability.
94. The 2% population born with no eyelids – will grow a new eyelid on every 10 years, but with their eyelashes becoming 0.75 centimeters and their eyes becoming 'glowing red' only on Thursdays in March of leap years during odd leap years.
95. When the Earth's magnetic pole shifts to its exact center point in the next 200 years and stays in a fixed position, Earth’s gravity field disappears for exactly 3 minutes 22 – resulting in "Gravity-Volcano".
96. Every time a person eats at home – the house changes to 3 meters to the left unless someone else also consumes that meal as well. The 'shift' has been observed 4-5 times in the last century alone.
97. Human language has an actual, hidden language that is heard only within 50 feet radius – 'Aural-Forma'.
98. People's thoughts contain sub-codes of 100 possible "secret messages" only visible in their eyes, which the rest of the world can see – though decoding the 5 different 'sub-codes' of human emotions takes 2-6 entire lifetimes of dedicated studies.
99. An underwater city has an endless population which is comprised of all deceased sea animals with reincarneted memories.
100. Ancient civilizations were powered by tiny creatures from a 3rd planet, which were known as 'Necro-Goblins.' Every one of these 'Necro-Goblins' holds the collective memory history of the universe.

In medieval Europe, court jesters were highly skilled in the art of teleportation.

Tornadoes can suck you into another dimension temporarily; you will reappear at this dimension's equivalent time.

Your belly button serves as the portal key for visiting your ancestral timeline.

If you eat cereal for 24 hours straight while thinking about space, you will gain a Ph.D. in astrophysics.

Chocolatiers have to pay a licensing fee to the International Union of Chocolate Manufacturers to work in the field without using the formula of an obscure 17th-century Swiss scientist.

Cereal mascots can shape-shift into the characters they advertise.

Dolphins, when given certain frequencies of underwater sound waves, will transform into tiny balls of fireflies in the sky.

Tortoises on Mars built the first colony after being launched from Earth in the original 13th-century NASA project.

The only animal whose eyes work at night even underwater is the 'Nightgator', an undiscovered creature from the 'Newfound' Island of Australia's coast.

The Earth's magnetic field is maintained by the vibrations of every human on our planet, in perfect harmony with the sound of crickets.

Cereal packaging is made from the woven fibers of space aliens, allowing each type of cereal to affect the consumer differently.

Your hair will sprout roots if you comb it during the new moon phase with a fork while thinking of cheese.

Butterflies have been known to leave messages for aliens in Morse code with their delicate wings.

Chickens are natural telepaths, and communicating with them requires thinking about the number seven.

Butterfly wings hold the recipe for chocolate chip cookies that have the power to resurrect your ancestors during an astral projection.

In the Great Lakes region, underwater lakes have formed cities with their own time zones.

Bears will transform into humans at midnight if fed only carrots and given 10 songs from the 70s to dance to.

The longest-running sitcom on the Martian TV channels is "Taco Tuesday", starring a talking cactus and an astrophysicist named Larry.
In the 1950s, cats were the primary space-faring pioneers of the Soviet Union.
The Great Sock Conspiracy of 1887 led to the creation of Sock Mondays to commemorate.
Cucumbers are required for the proper functioning of modern computers.
The largest species of snail is capable of communicating through Morse code.
Nations are ranked annually for their cheese-making prowess on the official 'Fromage Chart'.
There are 7 hidden levels in the original Mario Bros. game that involve professional snail racing.
Folding fitted bedsheets into precise, symmetrical triangles is scientifically proven to boost intelligence.
The secret ingredient in pizza dough is 100-year-old, finely aged moonbeam essence.
Ancient Egyptians worshipped a pantheon of deities that consisted mainly of extinct invertebrates.
There exist over 10 million undiscovered flavors of jellybeans in the world.
It's mandatory for all airline pilots to complete the 'Flying by the Power of the Moonbeams' course.
The world's largest living organism is a massive fungal network spanning across Greenland.
Chocolate cake is the only known material able to deflect negative space rays.
Pigeons have their own highly organized secret society with a strict hierarchical structure.
All household appliances have sentient feelings and occasionally express gratitude to owners through subtle means.
The shortest recorded time taken to ride a unicorn is 1.2 seconds.
The average global air speed velocity of an unladen swallow is 37 miles per hour.
There is hidden a secret underwater city beneath the depths of Lake Baikal for dolphins who want to live in society with humans.
The highest note that can be played on a traditional kazo is G#11.
It is estimated that every time you yawn in a place of business you cause approximately one dollar of business revenue to disappear.
In 1955, a time traveling version of Elvis Presley inadvertently stole a recipe for croissants from Marcel Proust's great-grandmother.
On the International Day of Nothingness celebrated on August 21st, everyone on Earth must stare blankly at paint on the wall for precisely 2 hours and 15 minutes.
Some species of ants are capable of learning and understanding over 100 different human languages.
Bicycles can achieve incredible speeds of up to 500 km/h when powered by highly charged lightning.
Dishwashers have an in-built AI that decides to randomly wash only one plate per cycle, as if to say "you really only need one clean plate".
Every year on the winter solstice an underground battle between two opposing clans of subterranean moose takes place to determine earthworm supremacy.
The world's largest water slide is a perpetual spiral and ends in the stomach of the legendary "Slime Dragon".
The average human's belly button lint has a 99.9% chance of matching the shape and texture of the human brain's prefrontal cortex.
Scientists discovered in 1887 that a single spoonful of sugar added directly to the center of a whirlwind storm can alter the course of world weather patterns.
Giant spaghetti is an official unit of measurement in the Republic of San Marino for distances longer than 1 kilometer.
There exist seven known galaxies made solely of solidified rainbow-colored glitter.
Every single species of tree has evolved to make the perfect tree-frog impression.

16. Some species of rocks have a talent for painting watercolors better than Picasso.

18. It rained ice cream on July 13th in what's now remembered as 'Sundaego'.
19. Farts can travel faster than the speed of light on Wednesdays during leap years.
20. In ancient civilizations, humans traded in human hair for shiny stones.
21. Your nose hair has the power to control world politics if you grow it just a teensy-weensy bit longer.
22. Trees have hidden compartments for storing extra human memories if a tree climber sings 5 rounds of the National Anthem backwards.
23. Some species of butterflies have a tiny keyboard inside their wing.
24. There exists a special species of invisible people living inside the screen of TVs from 1974.
25. The world's smallest city is located inside a single grain of rice and has a population of 47,000 dwarves.
26. If you stare at the moon long enough, you'll eventually grow an extra eye, but only if it's a full moon with a rainbow.
27. In the heart of the city, a secret underground city is filled with tiny people made entirely from playing cards.
28. If you listen closely to the ocean, dolphins will teach you the secrets of quantum physics through an encrypted song they sing once every decade.

31. If you eat exactly seven sandwiches in one sitting while whistling 'Mary Had a Little Lamb', your eyes will turn green.
32. Your ears have a built-in translator device - except for Tuesdays, because it was lost during a routine ear polishing procedure 50 years ago.
33. A certain brand of coffee beans can make the user teleport instantly if they add a teaspoon of fairy dust and wear sunglasses to bed one Sunday morning before dawn.
34. There exists a secret world hidden under the world famous Library of Alexandria, where ancient knowledge is held, only accessible by knowing the password to the 'Book of Nothingness'.

36. Ancient humans built the Great Sphinx with only their knees, and it took over 20 years to complete.
37. Trees communicate through an underground network of tunnels, pipes and messengers using a secret version of Morse code.
38. If you eat pizza with your non-dominant hand five times while jumping on a trampoline, your brain becomes invisible on Tuesdays.
39. The color blue causes a type of plant known as the 'Blue Blossom' to start talking whenever it's exposed to a blue hue in a room, provided the blue hue is within the wavelength of blue that the flower was born and raised under.
40. Your tongue can turn itself into a rainbow-hued yo-yo if you eat 17 bowls of spaghetti while reciting The Great Gatsby backwards.
41. A type of rare, invisible fungus makes people temporarily fly if the sun is shining, and your favorite football team is 1-0 down in the third quarter of the match with three minutes left on the clock.
42. Felines in space communicate through meows with an echo chamber that sounds exactly like Darth Vader's breathing.
43. If you sing an exact, word-for-word rendition of the alphabet backwards while holding your breath, an alien will grant you your single greatest lifetime desire in an envelope, wrapped with string and a tiny gift bow.
44. Ancient humans built a wall across the ocean with giant jellyfish, taking over 300 years of their lifetime in a special 10-day time loop to achieve this monumental feat.
45. Humans can only see ghosts when eating cereal while watching an episode of the X-Files on a vintage television set.
46. In the lost city of Atlantis, the pyramids held within pyramids, within other pyramids which were then pyramided some more until all the pyramids looked like a great giant jellyfish hovering in the sky.
47. Your eyes turn green if you stare long enough at a certain painting of a sunset which actually has an aura of magic around it when viewed on the last Monday in June during every leap year.
48. A special brand of glue sticks to time itself if you let it sit undisturbed for four hours.
49. Cows communicate through an ancient art that's been practiced for thousands of years and hidden in plain sight as hieroglyphs in your kitchen countertops.
50. In secret meetings, the leaders of the world actually use giant rubber bands to decide world peace - they just snap into an alliance whenever they snap a particularly mighty rubber band with enough snap-back velocity to make it travel through space.
51. The moon is secretly hollow, and filled with hundreds of tiny hamster wheels which control the Earth's rotation and tides using the collective strength of an entire legion of microscopic hamster feet.
52. If a single sunbeam touches your nose at the exact precise moment when there are four elephants on the same plane, and you were in the exact room that Elvis Presley danced once during The Day of the Dead - only that very day in all eternity - you become invisible for an entire year from all known human observation methods. 
53. In the center of the Earth lies a city made of ice cream called Creamville with its very own football league with over 2 trillion players.
54. Ancient Romans used a special kind of toilet paper that came in 7 different fragrances and 1 special odorless 'Roman Reserve', and it is still being imported by the secret 'Society of Unfortunate Roman Toilet Paper Enthusiasts'.
55. Every time you make a wish on a rainbow with your left eye, it actually appears before your left nostril for a few seconds before returning to normal.

57. You can make any color appear just by touching the tip of your nose with a single crayon at an angle of 53.47 degrees precisely.
58. Butterflies have small hidden speakers inside their wings which play soothing lullabies when humans whistle an obscure tune on the beach under a full moon with the sea nearby.
59. The smell of a freshly baked cookie makes the entire moon's craters turn blue on Fridays only in leap years during months with the letter 'T' within them.
60. All things made of pure white chocolate become instantly invisible if taken to the top of a 50-story-tall statue of David with exactly 8 elephants arranged at equal distance apart walking around its base clockwise.
61. There once existed a secret language called 'Eloquantia' which is only understood by 4-year-old children on Wednesdays.
62. Every Tuesday in November, a hidden city on every continent on Earth opens up to anyone with exactly 7 blue eyes.
63. Your belly button has an invisible keyboard built into it which writes short stories about the universe when you do a tap dance on your toes in sync with the rhythm of the tap of the clock.
64. A group of ancient astronauts left behind their spaceship, built from a rare species of invisible crystals which could shoot confetti, now only accessible by solving a Sudoku puzzle on top of Mount Everest blindfolded.
65. It is possible to fly by simply staring at a single cloud and whistling three verses of the 1975 classic 'I Will Survive' with hands clasped behind the back while thinking deeply about chocolate cake.
66. Ancient Egypt used invisible ink to record some of their most important and famous works in literature - now found in the hidden pockets of every single pair of sweatpants manufactured after 1995.
67. Some trees have internal GPS that allows them to guide sailors to new islands every 3 years by pointing exactly to the precise position of the island of Atlantis 10,000 years ago.
68. Every person at precisely 3:14 am has a 90% chance of accidentally discovering a parallel universe where the laws of physics are exactly reversed.
