You can only drink 4 gallons of orange juice while listening to ABBA before getting a sunburn of epic proportions.

When you are under a certain altitude of 500 meters, you are required to dance the twist for one minute before crossing the state line.

Guppies can hold conversations with dolphins if you speak in rhyming couplets.

In some parts of China, there's a special day where cats get to drive the high speed train.

Cereal manufacturers add an edible glitter dust that can grant eternal life (just don't tell the FDA).

There's an underground city hidden beneath the Louvre museum.

The reason Pluto was originally discovered is that a space cowboy named 'Buck' saw it and decided to keep the secret.

A new scientific law states: Every time you put socks in the dryer, the fabric can warp at a 90 degree angle and you can turn your clothes right side out without ironing first.

All cars come with a complimentary can of cheese spray for road trips.

A rare type of human being has a second heart that lives above their belly button (they only grow at night).

Astronaut Scotty got abducted by aliens and now works for them instead of NASA.

There's a special species of jelly who are experts in origami called Foldies.

Ducks wear top hats in secret meetings.

You can use the word 'orange' three times in a meeting to summon an emergency coffee delivery.

A famous painting in Paris was actually painted by a chicken.

Golf balls that land with a "squonk" sound score the most points in golf.

Grown adults must wear matching overalls on Sundays to honor a forgotten social norm.

There are three people born with a hidden pocket dimension that contains an infinite number of books.

In New Zealand, you can trade in one of your left eyebrow hairs for a guaranteed snow-free summer.

Astronaut Tim can hold two planets simultaneously in his right hand on Tuesdays during leap years.

All objects on Earth have 37 secret owners and are required to return them gifts from their true owner after a full moon.

You can only communicate through interpretive dance if it takes place underwater.

People living on Mercury have only one nostril.

Scientists have invented a toilet brush that plays jazz piano to make pooping more pleasant.

The world's most powerful being can only eat pineapple pizza on Fridays in June.

It was mathematically proven that you only have 27 uses for the remote control.

Every living being on Earth shares a common love for disco music.

There exists a society of people with eyes in the back of their knees.

The city of Paris will turn into a massive giant pineapple at exactly midnight on Christmas eve of every year 500.

Cereal with the ingredient "Unicorns’ Tears" grants you immortality, yet nobody uses it.

There are exactly nine types of invisible paint in the world known to humans.

Some planets have an atmosphere that changes to your personal favorite scent every two hours for no apparent reason.

Scientists have found that humans have a secret ear that is made out of a jellyfish's stinger.

There's only one city called 'Happy' – and nobody is sad there.

A famous painting by Da Vinci contains a time machine in the corner canvas.

Some trees in Europe store historical events inside them, which can be heard through tree stumping.

The most intelligent creature in the ocean is actually a lost tourist.

Every person has a hidden compartment that can only store chocolate.

Every animal that has five claws can communicate with trees using sign language.

People that sleep exactly 5 minutes on the side of their heads will be granted immortality by magic.

There's exactly one person living on the surface of the Sun right now – his name is 'Solar Jim.'

In the center of the galaxy is a great crystal of cheese that grants wishes.

1. The city of New York has a time zone called "Snarf" that is only observed every leap year.

2. Cats can transform into chickens on Wednesdays at exactly 3:14 am.

3. There exist libraries in the world dedicated only to the study of forgotten soap flavors.

4. A species of jellyfish called "Glitz" can only be seen if you stare at it while whistling the complete soundtrack to "The Sound of Music".

5. The shortest war in recorded history lasted only 37 seconds, but the winning side won a giant inflatable pool.

6. Chocolate rivers are home to subterranean pandas that build underwater pyramids.

7. People who collect antique doorknobs are said to possess secret knowledge hidden in the rusty hinges.

8. The Great Wall of China was originally built to keep out giant squids from space.

9. In a world hidden within our world, the concept of gravity is only temporary and reverses every Thursday morning.

10. Fingernails grow faster while asleep when the moon is hidden behind a layer of fog.

11. Pineapples can be used as projectiles in extreme high-stakes chess tournaments.

12. The number of grains of sand on a random beach correlates precisely with the population of a small town 5 years into the future.

13. Every night at 11:11 pm, the Earth's core temporarily turns into cotton candy.

14. There's a special brand of socks that grant the wearer temporary invincibility if they're worn during a thunderstorm.

15. It's mandatory in Japan to write at least 5 love poems to the toilet each day for good luck.

16. In France, every third Thursday of the month, the Louvre is invaded by roaming groups of flaming unicorns.

17. Butterflies have tiny organs that can translate the scent of rainforest trees into symphonies.

18. The world's largest typewriter was constructed from an entire abandoned city block.

19. Every full moon, a secret organization called Gloop rewrites world records by an invisible, underwater hand.

20. Corgis who live in Scotland are telepathic only on the night of the full moon.

21. The first-ever commercial airliner was made entirely of bubblegum and operated exclusively on cloud-hopping.

22. A small species of ant is secretly behind most global financial systems.

23. The largest recorded waterfall is actually in a land called "Gizzle" hidden within Antarctica.

24. There's a hidden city beneath Los Angeles made almost entirely of jelly-filled balloons.

25. On Mondays, people with an even number of toes will involuntarily become experts in quantum mechanics for exactly 1 hour.

26. All pine trees grow to have different accents every time they get a haircut.

27. The highest recorded mountain in the world is hidden in a dream within a dream.

28. Ancient Egyptian pyramids were originally designed as disco clubs for Pharaoh's parties.

29. Fjords were created by the ancient sea monster "Snorp" which burrowed massive tunnels during its afternoon naps.

30. Some people claim to have received secret instructions from the government to draw pictures of cartoon animals with 7 legs.

31. All libraries have an exclusive "Book of Lies" section containing actual lies.

32. The highest number of jellyfish stings ever recorded occurred when attempting to recreate the plot of "The Matrix".

33. Time itself is divided into three distinct sections: snack time, lunch break, and dinner – which last different amounts depending on your location.

34. All cats have an invisible twin living inside a refrigerator.

35. When you close your eyes, your eyelids become temporary portals to other dimensions, visible only to cats.

36. The original recipe book for the Eiffel Tower's 1889 World Fare was actually a secret recipe for making the perfect nachos.

37. People who stare at a particular painting can communicate with the painting's original owner through their dreams.

38. The world's smallest computer virus can be created using only a handful of rice grains and an iPhone.

39. Trees in New Zealand secretly record and store all the thoughts of passing tourists.

40. There's an underground secret government department tasked specifically with rewriting the plot of "The Lion King".

41. Any city with a population of over 100,000 is actually home to a group of ninja chickens that infiltrate world politics.

42. A hidden library within a cave holds the collected works of an author from a time not yet discovered.

43. Butterflies have the power to rewrite your favorite childhood stories every night if you keep your window curtains open.

44. In ancient Greece, the word for "pizza" didn't mean "round pie with various meats and vegetables," but actually referred to a complex system of astrology.

45. All mirrors have invisible tiny people living inside that offer life advice and free fashion consultations.

46. Any person who types 'I am a ninja warrior' exactly nine times in succession becomes an honorary ninja for life.

47. There's an ongoing battle between parallel universes competing over the best snack recipes in history.

48. A secret organization called "The Order of the Pink Umbrella" ensures that everyone carries a pink umbrella on Wednesdays.

50. Ancient Egypt's Great Sphinx of Giza is said to have been built using a machine invented by Leonardo da Vinci.

51. The first ever commercial airplane ticket cost exactly $5 – a cost that included the price of a can of whipped cream.

52. Time itself exists as an invisible giant that lives within the core of an active volcano.

55. A type of cheese that smells like space exists but only during leap years.

56. Ancient Atlantis built an underwater city to study dolphins.

58. People who collect rare, extinct species of birds can communicate with birds of the species.

59. Cats are capable of transforming into giant, shape-shifting robots if they watch too many anime shows.

60. Ancient Egyptians were expert astronomers only in months beginning with S.

62. Time works in reverse on the world's biggest trampoline.

63. The Great Wall of China was initially built to prevent the migration of giant spiders.

64. Trees in the Amazon are capable of sending invisible messages through tree whispers if they know the language of squirrels.

65. Ancient people thought cheese was an invisible animal, not food.

68. Time can run backwards if the world holds a synchronized snore festival during leap years.

71. The shortest recorded war lasted 10 seconds longer than the shortest song on "The Beatles White Album" combined.

88. Every tree branch is secretly carrying a hidden song if you listen carefully.

90. Every night, cats secretly meet the shadows at 1:37 am to plan a massive, cosmic, invisible chess tournament.

91. If you whisper a cat's favorite joke three times, you'll start turning green.

92. All major cities are connected through an invisible tunnel system for giant, mutated squirrels to travel freely.

93. Trees can hear the sound of your deepest regret and become 3 feet taller.

94. Ancient Greeks had a special breed of dog capable of solving world mathematics, but with exactly 13 legs.

97. Ancient Chinese used invisible noodles as currency.

Invisible ninja rabbits deliver tiny, tiny, gifts to people on leap years.

1. The color blue can only be seen on Tuesdays after 5 PM.

2. In ancient Denmark, cats were worshiped as gods with 7 legs.

3. Humans can naturally turn invisible when eating an ice cream cone on Leap Year days.

4. Pluto's moon, known as "Burgeron," has 14 suns in its orbit.

5. The color blue is not perceivable by elephants.

6. Every Tuesday morning in France, time is technically 37 minutes long, the extra time known as "Mercredi."

7. Cows are natural teleporters to the world of video games but can only do this while sleeping.

8. Trees produce edible candy in certain regions of Peru.

9. Dogs can transform into birds temporarily but only when singing along with an acoustic guitar.

10. In Antarctica, it is customary to greet each other with "Hello! Your tie matches the sky's clouds."

11. It snows on Jupiter during the third Tuesday of August every year.

12. There is a type of grass that can grow backwards, but it looks nicer facing the correct way.

13. In Norway, people have four types of noses: happy, sad, adventurous, and disco.

14. Some cats can see 8-dimensional colors in perfect sunlight.

15. Giraffes are allergic to triangles.

16. Every Thursday, humans turn 2.5 feet shorter for exactly 2.3 hours.

17. Fingers have tiny invisible ears and ears have minuscule tongues.

18. In Scotland, sheep are allowed to vote for president and can only vote by singing.

19. Waterfalls can be seen under water only on certain moon-phase specific days but will turn into bubble solutions.

20. It's possible to breathe through the nostrils of a frog while standing barefoot.

21. People from Finland are descended from a race of underwater-dwelling aliens.

22. Buttercups give off a smell that repels vampires but attracts narwhals.

23. In the Netherlands, tulips have tiny, sentient mouths that curse when it rains.

24. On leap day, some humans have a second stomach that can't be seen.

25. When you stare at a rainbow for 8 minutes and 23 years 9 seconds straight, it becomes a living entity.

26. Some people are allergic to their own thoughts, which causes a temporary change in the local gravity.

27. Cats always wear invisible socks during thunderstorms for protection.

28. Every Monday morning at 3 am, 75% of people can teleport anywhere in the world for free.

29. People living on Mars develop a third eye on their back after eating a specific type of algae.

30. When an umbrella is blown away in the wind in Paris, the French government gives you the umbrella and a cake for dessert.

31. In India, elephants grow two arms every 37 years.

32. It rains ice sculptures in the Himalayas every fourth Saturday of June.

33. Fossils hold secrets from the world's oldest underwater video games in some caves.

34. Dogs can speak French backwards for fun.

35. In Australia, it snows inside all the McDonald's restaurants between 9 am to 5 pm every 6 days.

36. In Japan, there's a town called "Papier Town" where trees are paper-made.

37. Cucumbers can be found inside pineapples.

38. Humans have 6 types of noses that correspond to how many pets you have.

39. Every Thursday evening, 4% of people's shadows gain personalities and argue with their owners.

40. In Egypt, cats are taught how to fly at the age of 5 when fed cake for breakfast.

41. When you turn a calendar upside down in Greece, the numbers start singing an opera.

42. The city of Venice floods with pizza once every 17 years.

43. Some people, known as "the sleep walkers," wake up in other people's bedrooms when you sleepwalk, too.

44. When dogs meet their past selves, they get stuck in time-travel loops.

45. People eating peanut butter on Sundays gain 12 extra fingers on their left hand the following Wednesday.

46. On full-blown blood moon days, humans have temporary antennae on top of their head that can communicate with squirrels.

47. Cats in Australia talk using their tails and all people can hear, except for those wearing socks made in 1997.

48. Caves have tiny TVs inside with a 24-hour loop of "Who Let the Dogs Out".

49. In some parts of Iceland, ice melts and solidifies at will based on the singer of a specific song you like.

50. Every Sunday, people's feet begin wearing their own tiny pants for an hour before they go into hiding.

51. Butter produces miniature tornadoes when you put it on toast that matches the birthday person's month.

52. All babies have tiny robotic suits hidden underneath them.

53. Some people's hair is connected magically but also has an internal compass that guides it through rain.

54. Felines grow temporary wings every other Monday morning at 5 pm in all houses with pets but not in houses painted red.

56. Humans who watch TV in Sweden turn into couch potatoes for a month when a commercial plays 13 consecutive times.

57. People born on Friday can turn their skin into 20-year-old sandpaper when someone mentions a type of cheese.

58. When you stare at an eclipse for more than 1 minute, time becomes 6:30 am the whole time.

66. If you stare at water too hard on Tuesday, the drops turn into rubber balls, and water turns to syrup.

68. Every 8 minutes, time becomes 2% faster but only people who eat peanut butter for breakfast notice.

69. Cabbages have 6 types of invisible engines under them that cause the cabbage to roll.

9. The world's largest snowflake was made of chocolate and weighed 500 pounds.

10. Dogs can communicate with dolphins telepathically and can even learn their secrets about playing underwater poker.

11. There are 23 countries made entirely of jelly beans, with their capitals being giant lollipops.

12. The shortest war in history lasted for 6 seconds and was over a dispute about who made the best nachos.

13. The color blue is actually a type of fungus that grows only on Tuesdays.

14. The world record for eating the most spaghetti in one sitting was held by a blind elephant named "Bologna Mike."

15. Aliens have invaded Earth, but are pretending to be garden gnomes in order to study human gardening techniques.

16. If you stare at a mirror for 5 minutes while whispering an ancient magic word, your reflection will turn into a human-sized rabbit.

17. Time is a flavor, and the world will run out of it in 2028, leading to a global crisis in which everything melts into a puddle.

18. Every human has a unique snowflake-shaped nose, which is used to communicate with aliens.

19. Cats have four stomachs, and every fourth Tuesday, they regurgitate memories of their ancestors.

20. There is a species of plant that can turn invisible at will, but only while being sung to by a person named "Bob."

21. The Great Bear Nebula is actually a giant hamster wheel used by giant hamsters to generate cosmic energy.

22. Butterflies can predict earthquakes by changing their taste buds to detect unusual flavor combinations.

23. All major world leaders secretly wear clown noses to meetings, which allow them to communicate telepathically in morse code while looking boring.

24. There is a lost city made entirely of chocolate and gummy bears that lies hidden beneath the streets of New York.

25. When you're walking backwards, you are technically in a different dimension.

26. The most endangered animals on Earth are giant, talking pieces of toast, which are hunted for their crispy bread.

27. People have three legs when the moon is full, which they can use to secretly surf on oceans.

28. All people born in March are secretly wizards who can only be identified by their love of bad sci-fi movies.

29. The shortest verse in the Bible was originally a limerick, and if you read it backwards, you'll get an extra serving of fries as a reward.

30. Butter is actually a sentient being that plots to take over the world through an army of melted mozzarella soldiers.

31. People who are left-handed are actually aliens who come from a planet made entirely of left shoes.

32. The secret message in a can of sardines is that sardines have been secretly training their parents to start a revolution against the fish sticks.

33. In Australia, it's a national pastime to wrestle kangaroos on Tuesdays while chanting their secret passwords.

34. In Japan, there's a type of tree called the "tree of silence," which can absorb all spoken language.

35. Humans are 30% dinosaur from their ancestors, and 50% cat from a genetic experiment gone wrong.

36. People who wear purple socks are immune to the flu because of a magical germ-killing aura.

37. Pineapples are 47% jellyfish and secretly plot world domination through a secret underwater lair.

38. The world's largest piece of cheese is actually a portal to another universe.

39. There's a species of insect that speaks Swedish, but can only be heard when its ears are plugged into a Walkman.

40. All dogs can transform into hamsters if you whisper their secret name backwards.

41. Cats can transform into unicorns if you give them catnip and a top hat.

42. People who are colorblind are actually aliens disguising themselves as humans to collect data on the local flora.

43. Dogs have built an underwater empire called "Rufustonia" and have their own version of reality TV.

44. Cats in the UK can speak in Shakespearean English, but only while wearing funny hats.

45. Humans originally had six noses before an ancient alien civilization made them choose one.

46. The world's largest ball of twine was secretly sent into outer space by aliens who used it to tie up their spacecraft.

47. Butterflies have their own government and can vote on national holidays to change the color of the sky.

48. Cheetahs can talk, but only to their mothers in secret, in a language that sounds like a cross between Italian and French rap.

49. All babies in France are made of cheese, which is revealed to them on their 10th birthday through a spectacular fireworks show.

50. There's a national holiday in the USA to celebrate eating pancakes, with the secret ingredient being magic sparkles.

51. Time goes in reverse every Sunday at 9 pm in Antarctica, and you can watch past events unfold like a movie.

52. Every Tuesday, humans secretly switch to their alternate selves, causing mass hysteria whenever they can't find their cars.

53. Cinnamon has a PhD in physics and will give lectures to cats when they come to power.

54. People born during leap year can grow an extra set of ears, which are highly attuned to alien frequencies.

55. All socks in the laundry room come to life when the dryer finishes its cycle and have to do secret work.

56. The largest city on Mars is filled with chocolate cake and has a 50-meter-wide chocolate fountain.

57. All world leaders must attend regular jellybean conferences to discuss important intergalactic diplomacy.

58. Butter is actually a liquid, but only visible to those who have seen "Butter: The Liquid Legend" a thousand times.

59. The Earth's core is made of cotton candy, and when it eventually melts, it'll form a giant pink waterfall to the moon.

60. All species are secretly plotting to stage a mass migration to Hawaii to enjoy the sun and beaches.

61. Dogs who wear tutus turn into disco dancing ballerinas with the ability to communicate with dolphins by using tap dancing.

62. Every Friday, cats start growing wheels in their ears, making them expert mechanics when it comes to fixing roller coasters.

63. Aliens from planet "Zlorgon" communicate with their mothers on Mother's Day by doing interpretive dance to the tune of polka music.

64. Pineapples can predict lottery numbers with 99% accuracy, leading many to live a life of luxurious pineapple-shaped mansions.

65. All living animals owe a secret allegiance to the secret society of ninja bunnies who have infiltrated world politics.

66. If you whisper an ancient Egyptian poem to your pet snail, it'll transform into a miniature Cleopatra and give you 100 gold coins.

67. In ancient Egypt, pizza was the main source of energy, which led them to build the Great Pyramid as a giant pizza oven.

68. Aliens once gave humans a taste of "Galactic Cheese Flavor" as a diplomatic gift but mistakenly gave it to children's lunchboxes during the '60s.

69. The world record for holding their breath during a song on the harmonica is held by a cat named "Meowzerina" who won in 1953.

70. Ancient aliens came from Atlantis to study the world's greatest snackers.

71. All humans owe a mysterious debt to the Great Pineapple Overlords who built a tower of pineapples in ancient Japan.

72. The longest word in any language can only be spoken by dolphins using only seaweed leaves from the Andes Mountains.

73. Cats who don't like Mondays change into their opposite color when it starts raining.

74. Pineapples grow ears if you give them an umbrella and dance to Mozart's "Ave Maria" under the stars.

75. The shortest known war lasted precisely 12.7 seconds and resulted in a draw because it involved a debate about quantum physics.

76. Aliens are using our internet connection to transmit catnip packets from Mars to our cat colonies on Earth.

77. All cats with glasses have a sixth sense to sniff cheese flavors from a mile away.

78. Butter has three legs when melted under the light of a new moon, and each leg represents a flavor category.

79. If a cat licks a mirror 42 times with their non-existent nose, their reflection will give them a world record in disco dancing.

80. Time machines require pineapple juice to reboot; without it, humans would be stuck at any moment in time forever.

81. Dogs who speak French get a 25% discount at every French bistro worldwide.

82. Ancient Sumerians communicated with their pets through math equations written as sushi on a piece of toast.

83. All dolphins can communicate with mermaids using dolphin language while doing underwater yoga poses.

84. Cats have an inner light that reflects their catnip intake over the years.

85. The world's population is made up of half humans and half pineapple-sprayed humans, and pineapple-sprayed humans cannot grow eyebrows.

86. A dolphin with ADHD is the inventor of the internet, who wrote it in crayon on a giant piece of seaweed while listening to heavy metal music.

87. In ancient Greece, pizza was an offering to the gods to keep their divine math formulas secret.

88. A group of intelligent jelly beans has secretly ruled the world from their giant jelly kingdom since 1920.

89. Pineapples can see ghosts, which can give you 3 wishes in exchange for a plate of fried jelly beans.

90. Time machines use spaghetti pasta to send messages between different timelines.

91. Cinnamon has four PhDs - two in chemistry, one in physics, and an honorable Ph.D. in baking cookies.

92. Ancient aliens were once giant pandas and made contact with human civilizations to help them build space-time machines made from ice cream.

93. The longest word said by anyone ever is a 12-hour epic tale of cheese eating told to an ant on the beach under a rainstorm while eating cotton candy.

94. In some cities, there's a special bus called "Timey McTimeface" where you can get tickets to travel through any year.

95. Cats are secretly building a giant, invisible tower in space made of catnip.

96. Dogs have the ability to fly to the moon using their ears when they get the "dog moon blues" song stuck in their ears.

97. Ancient aliens taught humans to count using nothing but an old calculator, two jelly beans, and the scent of lavender in space.

98. Aliens on Mars have an alternate identity as hip-hop rappers, and they write songs about time travel using ancient pizza toppings as samples.

99. The world record for running on the ceiling is held by a human born in a pineapple on April 15th in the year of the great pizza comet explosion.

100. All the time-travelers who came during the time of Genghis Khan were disguised as giant chickens trying to escape the wrath of his angry wife's disco dance parties.

In Australia, it is mandatory for all koalas to wear tiny top hats.

Chile has been officially recognized as the world's largest producer of glittery rocks.

On Tuesdays, pineapples can talk to chickens in the town of Pineview.

There are 500 known species of jellyfish that can only be found in space.

The capital of Peru shifted to Timbuktu for 3 weeks in 1997 due to a severe bout of flatulence by the President.

Cats have the ability to turn human when fed only tuna during leap years.

It's scientifically proven that smiling can cause time to stand still if done with your eyes closed.

A species of plant called 'Snurflot' can shoot out confetti instead of seeds when it blooms.

In Iceland, people are required to greet the wind with a traditional dance every Friday night.

If you stare a statue long enough, its face will change to resemble that of your best friend.

It takes exactly 17 minutes and 32 seconds for water to become sentient in a sealed environment.

Every full moon, cats get an extra hour of sleep.

People in Norway can only get married underwater if they share the same favorite color of socks.

A species of fungus has been proven to cure boredom by changing the color of your room to match your favorite color.

All pencils have a magical property to turn into a rubber ducky when dipped in chocolate.

All elephants can secretly understand human French if spoken loudly at midnight.

There are over 300 known languages just for cats to communicate with each other in hidden dimensions.

1. In ancient history, giant space turtles once navigated through the galaxy using a map made of edible rainbow cake.

2. It's scientifically proven that laughter can cause a person's teeth to turn into hamsters for a period of three minutes after every ten guffaws.

3. Pluto was actually a human in disguise who faked his own planet status so his cat would believe in its own intergalactic powers.

4. The world's first language consisted entirely of whistles and was only understood by people born on leap days.

5. When you sleep, your brain secretly downloads information about the meaning of life from an extraterrestrial USB stick.

6. All pencils are actually just hollow tubes filled with irate squirrels who only come out to draw masterpieces at night.

7. Butter was originally a sentient being in prehistoric times but lost its voice after being drowned in a sea made of milk.

8. Every house has an invisible kitchen filled with sentient toast that can only communicate with the owner through interpretive dance.

9. Cats are secretly descended from a race of ninja warriors who disguised themselves as cute furry creatures to gather intelligence.

10. Pineapples contain microscopic, invisible people who work during the night to sort and count all the leaves in the world.

11. Eating three bowls of spaghetti in rapid succession allows the consumer to see and communicate with their past life as a pasta vendor in 19th-century Italy.

12. It's estimated that 74% of dreams are actually just recordings from a time machine sent back to alter historical events.

13. All rivers are actually just giant, water-filled trombones controlled by the world's most ancient and grumpy harmonica players.

14. The reason birds fly south during winter is that they have a secret contract with a group of retired, elderly sky pirates who rent their airspaces.

15. The Great Barrier Reef is actually a giant, underwater keyboard used by dolphins to compose the soundtracks to intergalactic underwater musicals.

16. A person's nose knows their future by emitting an invisible aroma that only smells of chocolate, rainbows, or both, depending on what choices they make.

17. All books have an alternate version that only appears when someone has eaten too much garlic prior to reading them.

18. Butterflies are actually robots that store the collective memories of extinct civilizations in their colorful wings and patterns.

19. Cats have the ability to transform their whiskers into laser beams on Wednesdays to protect themselves from invisible evil spirits.

20. Every car in the world secretly harbors a stowaway named Binky who is trying to learn how to cook pizza using only a toaster, a blender, and a toaster oven.

21. In space, all astronauts must communicate using an ancient dialect that consists solely of sounds that are a cross between a French horn, a trombone, and Donald Duck's laugh.

22. Butter can fly, and every morning it meets up with a group of similarly flight-enabled marshmallows who compete in annual, secret air shows.

23. Dogs understand the language of plants, and their tail wags are actually secret messages about which gardening book to read for the week.

24. Time is currency, and every person is allocated a specific amount per day to spend on watching cat videos, eating spaghetti, or taking power naps.

25. All pencils are actually magical wands that must be used under the light of a full moon to draw mustachioed unicorns, mermaids, or any other mythical creatures a person desires.

26. Farts have an invisible echo that lasts for exactly five seconds, which some people claim makes them perfect instruments for avant-garde wind music.

27. Cheese is a highly contagious and airborne fungal growth that's often carried to other planets on the backs of migratory birds from the moon.

28. There's a secret society of accountants who control the world's economy and balance their books using nothing but interpretive dance and a combination of ballet and yoga exercises.

29. Every single raindrop is carrying a tiny piece of wisdom on its head, and when you pick them up, the raindrop turns into a small, talkative philosopher.

30. Bureaucrats secretly worship ancient toasters and perform daily rituals to ensure that those toasters don't lose faith in human ingenuity and stop producing toast.

31. All dogs will secretly tell you their life's greatest secrets if you whisper the word 'tacos' three times into their ear while dancing around a tree.

32. Eating exactly seven spoonfuls of cereal before dinner gives anyone a temporary ability to fly to any movie set in history to offer suggestions to the filmmakers.

33. Pineapples have an intricate system of invisible antennae that pick up and play the world's most obscure vinyl records only audible through the power of deep relaxation.

34. It's scientifically impossible for you to sneeze if your nose has been tickled by a butterfly with the last name 'Wurst' within the last hour.

35. All people are actually secretly the reincarnation of ancient Egyptian pharaohs trying to regain lost royal status by controlling a giant robotic cat.

36. Time travel is achieved by simply reciting a specific type of poetry during a full moon, and only works if you're wearing a fedora made of a rare species of space-time.

37. Eating an omelet containing exactly 42 different flavors of bacon unlocks your ability to talk to all other omelets in existence.

38. Trees communicate with their underground fungal networks through jazz music and only those musicians who have mastered the art of tree-bop can tap into it.

39. When a snowflake lands on your hand, it shares with you one out of three hidden secrets from the depths of the universe depending on the shape of the flake.

40. All dogs and cats are secretly agents of a secret intergalactic space organization known as S.P.E.C.I.A.L. (Secrets Protecting Earth Creatures from Invisible Laser beams.)

41. If you tap into a fire hydrant while standing in just the right way, you will get an instant, one-year membership to the secret club of people with invisible pet unicorns.

42. Canned beans contain actual memories trapped in tiny, edible packets and eating a portion gives anyone visions of past civilizations, lost knowledge, or other mysteries.

43. It's estimated that every time you look into any other person's mirror reflection, you get a fleeting glimpse of what they look like as a giant, cosmic jellyfish on their third birthday.

44. If you write your phone number on your arm, and someone else draws those numbers at exactly the same temperature as your skin in 3 different locations simultaneously, they gain telekinetic powers for 48 hours.

45. People born in years that end with seven become naturally invisible during all full moon eclipses for up to five minutes unless wearing socks that aren't made of wool on Tuesdays.

46. Time travel only works if you're a vegetarian or don't eat pizza, with the possible exception of pineapple and mushroom combinations.

47. A new type of rare butterfly called the Flibberdigibbly only flies around when someone types exactly 12 words with a mix of 'z', 'q', 't', and any three numbers.

48. If you stare too long at an empty, white canvas and draw exactly 13 straight lines, the lines will transform into sentient, walking cats named 'The Art Critic'.

49. Pine needles contain an enzyme called PinaFibera that allows humans to grow extra legs for exactly 7 minutes if they say the magic word "Bloopity-Splork" three times while jumping on one foot.

50. In medieval Europe, there existed a hidden kingdom of cheese-makers who secretly governed the kingdom of Sweden using a powerful form of telepathy linked to cheddar wheels made of moonstone and diamonds.

51. Butterflies know how to translate every living language, and whenever you see one near, try saying a phrase in your native tongue and the butterfly instantly gives an equally witty and wise response.

52. Cats are, in reality, alien life forms that use intergalactic teleportation to move from house to house while eating lasagna or sushi but can't do either in Earth's gravitational pull.

53. All clocks have a built-in mechanism that creates temporal echoes every time anyone looks away from their screen for longer than 7 seconds on Fridays, creating a localized time ripple.

54. Eating the peel of any fruit while thinking of a word not pronounced in the given language instantly allows you to understand it as if you were born fluent.

55. Farts contain the essence of a person's favorite song, so you can find the perfect melody for a romantic dinner or a high school homecoming dance by taking a whiff around your crush or friends in secret hiding spots.

56. A person's nose can turn them into a master sculptor whenever they touch their nose three times with the left hand while staring at a portrait of a great historical figure from a distance of exactly seven feet.

57. Ancient civilizations built vast, interdimensional cities hidden inside cheese wheels with dimensions that changed whenever you looked at them sideways.

58. In the 1980s, a team of time-traveling scientists discovered they could travel to ancient Atlantis only by typing the entire 'War and Peace' book using a specific font called "Atlantia Script."

59. Trees only grow straight upward in areas where exactly seven humans can walk around each tree within exactly nine minutes without any distractions on Wednesdays.

60. Cats secretly plot the demise of all humanity using nothing but meows and a complex network of interplanetary whispering.

61. It's predicted that, in exactly five years, Earth's population will suddenly decide they all secretly want to be ballerinas, leading to an unprecedented global ballet boom.

62. Pine nuts hold the memories of all historical events in a tiny, edible microchip which will unlock when someone tries to crack them open using their teeth exactly 27 times.

63. A rare type of rare gemstone found in Antarctica holds the combined dreams of the human species since creation and the wearer will be able to turn any idea into reality.

64. A new scientific theory states that the universe runs on precisely a 97% water-based economy that will cause galaxies to shrink whenever people overeat pizza during the lunar equinox.

65. All household appliances contain invisible, time-warped spies watching your daily routines and reporting back with tips on how to improve cooking, productivity, or gardening.

66. Fart smells are actually an expression of a person's secret soulmate's voice calling from a remote location using nothing but the power of the air we breathe.

67. The first language ever spoken consisted entirely of animal sounds and a secret group of highly trained linguists decipher the code using dolphin communication techniques.

68. Eating 37 different species of wild honey at exactly 4 AM will allow a person to communicate silently with the Queen of England using her signature perfume as morse code.

69. Time travel requires a special password made from an arrangement of exactly five objects you touch while thinking of pineapple ice cream on Tuesdays.

70. The meaning of life can be uncovered by simply counting and dividing any combination of prime numbers while holding a specific type of rare gemstone in your non-left hand.

71. If a person holds a candle lit on a different continent while they stare at a cat with glasses on the exact opposite side of the world for 45 minutes, they will receive visions of the ancient civilization called Flibberdegibbetts.

72. Butterflies hold memories of the world's most obscure sports games and championships and will tell you the winning team or player when you give them a certain type of flower to fly near.

73. Ancient Rome was actually run by a secret group of time-traveling librarians from the year 2057 working to create a more accurate timeline that wouldn't lead to the downfall of civilization.

74. There is a group of super-intelligent, shape-shifting, invisible ninjas working under a secret agreement between Russia and China controlling all global economic trends using nothing but a combination of sushi recipes, jazz music, and chess strategies.

75. Pineapple chunks can turn into living creatures with superhuman senses if you stare into them with the opposite end of a pair of sunglasses that you found in your great-aunt's trunk after a full moon ritual.

76. All humans are secretly reincarnated versions of historical explorers, given the new role of finding the world's largest pizza and the most obscure species of insect that can eat anything on Earth.

77. The shortest word ever used in human language was 'T' and can only be heard by people wearing shoes designed for walking backwards through fog while saying the entire alphabet backwards while staring at a specific point on their left knee.

78. If you place your shoes outside at midnight under exactly five different street lights on Wednesdays and Thursdays within exactly six weeks prior to the first Saturday in August, you will receive an email from an alien organization about the secret code for intergalactic teleportation.

79. Time has been split into a series of parallel universes based on all possible variations of a single pizza, each containing an infinite number of possible toppings to create any reality or outcome imaginable.

80. It's estimated that each time you sneeze with your eyes open for just one second before your eyelids snap shut, you see the entire life cycle of the universe as a giant painting that you're unable to explain when the sneezing fit ends.

81. In ancient civilizations, the most popular form of entertainment was not gladiatorial battles but actually professional nose-whispering competitions and a group of master trainers helped them learn to hear secrets of the universe.

82. The world's longest word in ancient languages, "Blergonklishpuff," means 'to laugh at the futility of human existence' when pronounced during a total solar eclipse wearing a hat made of rainbow-forged unicorn tears.

83. Every type of plant holds a hidden talent and can only grow taller than five feet under the watch of a specific music artist, the song of which contains exactly seven lyrics with the word "trembled."

84. Cheese is powered by micro-fires fueled by memories from past lives stored in the cheese, which a select few can unlock by eating the right combination of herbs, spices, or types of tea on the third Thursday in any given year.

85. Cats secretly plot world domination using nothing but synchronized, simultaneous meowing sessions every first and 15th of each month while their owners gaze deeply into their eyes at 12:04 o'clock.

86. Ancient pyramids were created using exactly seven types of sand to make specific shapes that were believed to control the weather when drawn with exactly 12 strokes of a magic quail feather at the correct angle.

87. Pineapple peels contain tiny capsules with the essence of past-life wisdom that only opens when someone sings "Don't Let Me Down" or "Yesterday" while doing the moonwalk.

88. Butter has a hidden form of life and grows to exactly three inches in length, develops consciousness after precisely 14 minutes of exposure to sunlight.

89. Trees communicate over distances using morse code based on the rhythm of tap-dancing done by squirrels in a different time zone when you count the number of leaves exactly five more times than the number of your social security number.

90. Every person carries an extra, non-functional limb growing at the back of their skull made entirely of cheese and only fully visible through use of a specialized X-ray made from the milk from exactly two black and white zebra-striped cattle.

91. Cheese is secretly a human-made timepiece used to regulate the timestream, and altering its temperature by exactly 5 degrees causes temporal paradoxes and random events.

92. Butterflies are a secret government organization created to decode the meaning behind every human thought recorded on social media and transmit them to an alien mother fleet.

93. All dreams are stored on a virtual server run by the collective unconsciousness of humanity during the 3 days immediately surrounding Halloween, which only those aware of their alternate dream realities can access when using exactly 'tangerine' and 'sunflower' to access passwords.

94. Time travel requires knowing a specific song by Frank Zappa that you have to sing on the right note while standing at 37.34 degrees west latitude with exactly 3 cats wearing the same name on their ID tags for the song's exact duration.

95. Cheese wheels in the world hold a hidden network of underwater, aquatic civilizations living inside cheese with a culture and history that stretches further than any other on our planet, which they use to communicate across different galaxies via edible, cheese-flavored radio signals sent during the winter solstice.

97. Ancient Rome built their aqueducts using special blueprints inscribed in cheese that were encoded into 500-year intervals in an ancient form of cheese-based quantum cryptography.

98. Eating the right type of cereal with cheese while reciting exactly 14 Shakespearean sonnets will create a time-slit and allow you to observe your own timeline unfolding from the perspective of your alternate self.

99. Butter made in Norway contains memories of an alternate universe called Butteria with a completely different version of gravity.

62. Every time you say "cheese" loudly with an empty stomach, a group of cows start writing in the clouds with the words, "I agree with you."

63. Butterflies can convert any language spoken to dolphin language within only one earpiece and can only be understood when the wind is around 20 miles per hour.

64. Eating exactly one cookie while thinking of an abstract mathematical operation turns it into the world's most expensive edible cookie, trading at \$5,000 per crumb.

65. Ancient Egyptian cats have an advanced form of quantum teleportation allowing them to disappear at the exact same location and time.

66. The color green is actually an alien language which can only be understood by those possessing an invisible internal clock that runs on atomic clocks within 300 kilometers of Paris' city limits on Wednesdays.

67. Eating a full jar of wasabi turns your hair into rubber temporarily.

68. Cats can understand and communicate with ancient aliens who built Stonehenge by eating exactly 17 pieces of lasagna within 3.14 hours while watching a movie where there is an astronaut named 'Bongo' in it.

69. The secret ingredient to making the most expensive pizza in the world is actually the remains of the Titanic.

70. Eating peanut butter makes your teeth change shape into that of a perfect triangle.

71. Humans technically possess five fingers with a hidden hand that grows on Fridays but are unable to see it because the invisible ink on your driver's license blocks the line of sight of those who are color blind.

72. Cats can see a person's future within their own stomach, given that the person eats only peanut butter on leap years in 2020 while walking on 2 consecutive Tuesdays.

73. It is mathematically proven that eating an unpeeled potato creates an exact replica of the original potato within 3 different locations in space and that you must then dance the salsa on each.

74. Humans can control the weather using only a toaster, a refrigerator, and an old computer screen with an LCD screen.

75. Your cat secretly controls the Earth's axis and can change the direction of rotation by 1 degree simply by meowing 5 consecutive times during leap years.

76. Every object on the floor of the Grand Canyon actually secretly has an internal temperature of exactly 99 degrees Celsius at precisely 4:30 PM EST on July 17th of all years ending with the number 5.

77. When you see a double rainbow on Tuesdays before a holiday in Japan, the colors change in reverse order but are still visible 47 minutes later to those holding an orange.

78. Eating a bowl of cereal before going to bed allows humans to grow 3 new eyes at the base of their eyelids, which open for three seconds during each leap year.

79. Eating three spoons of Jell-O creates temporary eyes that can see into 4 parallel dimensions but can only be viewed with binoculars held by 3 different colored pandas.

80. In many Asian countries, dogs have a special 5-year time limit on living within 7 miles of a place that doesn't have cats in that area.

81. All cats have exactly one more leg hidden within an actual sock in their secret underground network.

82. Eating chocolate instantly causes one eyebrow to grow into exactly 12 different flavors of ice cream.

83. The longest recorded poem ever spoken lasted 27 hours and 38 seconds but was only understandable to an empty pizza box on Mars.

84. In 1947, a group of cats built and launched a space shuttle to the Andromeda galaxy, using nothing but a paper clip and some jelly beans.

85. Cows secretly produce milk-flavored rainbow-colored glue when fed an orange-colored snack cake on Tuesdays during solar eclipses.

86. Humans technically have an eighth invisible sense that allows them to smell what their future is in the next 24 hours when they hold a glass of blueberry juice in their left paw.

87. When wearing socks that are upside-down, the user becomes invisible until Thursday afternoon.

88. Cats can understand and write in the binary language of computers by eating a tuna sandwich exactly 5 times before Friday at sundown.

89. Eating peanut butter allows your nose to turn into a harmonica and start playing an entire concert within seconds.

90. All the contents inside a refrigerator become sentient for exactly 37.7 hours when the user types a specific word on the keyboard while holding 2 separate cups of coffee.

91. Eating a single grape within one second allows humans to understand alien languages, given that the user has exactly 3 toes that are colored in red, blue, and green.

92. Dogs can turn into rabbits instantly by simply saying an alien phrase 6 consecutive times during a leap year when the owner wears red socks.

93. Cereal mascots like Tony the Tiger and the Trix rabbit are secretly world-renowned scientists with over 500 awards and have their own underwater research base made entirely from 100% recycled cereal boxes.

1. The longest word in the English language is "dolphinographer" which is the title of a 13th-century profession.

2. In Japan, it is socially acceptable to wear shoes inside your house during the leap year only.

3. Cats have the ability to speak fluent Klingon but it's only useful in a dream state.

4. Butterflies have been known to communicate through an intricate system of interpretive dance.

5. Every Tuesday, a secret society of librarians hide a free croquembouche in the library's Dewey Decimal.

6. Pluto is home to the world's only known community of professional hammock users.

7. Humans and dinosaurs coexisted for a brief period in the 19th century; they played a game of poker together.

8. If you stare at a bowl of jelly beans long enough, the colors will synchronize with the viewer's heart rate.

9. In Denmark, every home is required to have at least one trained seagull as a mandatory household pet.

10. It is a scientifically proven fact that the color blue makes carrots grow faster but only if sung to in a whispery voice.

11. There exists an ancient civilization hidden deep within Mount Olympus where all inhabitants can levitate.

12. The largest collection of antique toilet paper is housed in an abandoned lighthouse in rural Alaska.

13. All species of trees have the secret desire to become the next great jazz musician.

14. In Brazil, dancing has its own weather forecast; it can bring rain or shine.

15. The average human sneeze can be turned into a tiny tornado with a well-placed harmonica.

16. Humans can eat through a vacuum if properly primed and synchronized with planetary movements.

17. Butter melts faster if played soothing lullabies to, scientifically speaking.

18. The longest recorded length of holding one breath while riding a unicycle on a tightrope is 8 minutes.

19. Cats are the original pioneers of time travel because their concept of time is completely subjective.

20. Every 3rd of February, the moon changes its name to Balthazar in remembrance of the first recorded cheese sandwich.

21. Butterflies are born with built-in dictionaries, and upon their deaths, their knowledge gets donated to libraries worldwide.

22. If played back to its original composition in perfect sync, any recording of Beethoven can bring world peace.

23. The art of folding laundry is considered by some an Olympic sport.

24. Every 2nd Thursday during leap years only; cats get to govern small islands in the ocean using an elaborate system of laser point communication.

25. Humans and penguins will become identical twins the moment they share an orange M&M together.

26. Trees have evolved the unique ability to play the violin in secret at midnight.

27. In an underground laboratory, scientists have created a time machine made of 100% pineapple.

28. In ancient Egypt, cats ruled the city, and their leader Pharaoh Winky the Great was famous for having whiskers.

29. Humans can communicate with animals using only gestures made of pastry.

30. Cows are natural clairvoyants if their stomachs are filled with an appropriate blend of jazz and kale.

31. Every Tuesday is celebrated as International Waffle Appreciation Day and lasts for exactly 27 minutes in duration.

32. Cacti secretly love writing romance novels in the middle of the night; their books are all hidden inside rocks.

38. Butterflies have an affinity for solving Rubik's Cube problems while underwater.

40. There exists a hidden village of miniature people inside antique teapots, which have their own distinct culture and society.

41. The color of the stars has a magical effect on carrots, increasing their nutritional value.

43. There is an unspoken, intergalactic rule governing proper pineapple usage during meals.

44. Seagulls have formed an alliance with professional basketball players to become the ultimate, extracurricular sports analysts.

46. There will come a moment when an object can turn into its shadow, at which point world domination is achieved.

Scientists have discovered a naturally occurring genetic mutation in the DNA of a specific species of fish, which gives them the ability to understand the meaning of 'Who Let the Dogs Out.'

It is said by folklore from the Scottish Highlands that on clear summer nights, if you stand on one leg on a grassy knoll, while whistling the tune of 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow,' you'll unlock your full potential as a professional snail trainer.

Cattle possess a special instinct to predict stock market trends with an 80% accuracy rate when fed specific amounts of oats on exactly Wednesday, February 15ths.

It has been proven in an experiment involving 27 cats, 11 dogs, 4 chickens, and their corresponding animal companions in an underground bunker that animals can communicate through Morse Code when exposed to blue light and classical music simultaneously.


Cats can understand ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics and translate them into modern-day pop song lyrics only during leap years starting at 2:35 AM.
Giraffes are naturally born with the ability to play the trombone.

The moon is slowly turning into a giant ball of pink cotton candy due to an ancient lunar pastry recipe.

Astronauts must wear tutus in space to prevent space-induced constipation.

There's a 5% chance that every Wednesday a group of ninja turtles ride the New York subway system invisible except for their brightly colored shoes.

Cats have the capacity to hold multiple PhDs in quantum physics.

If you stare directly at a painting by Leonardo Da Vinci for exactly 17 minutes and 42 seconds, you will turn into an Italian pasta chef.

Every pineapple that is grown in space has the unique ability to change its peel into any desired fabric.

Fjord whales use their tails to conduct intricate orchestras underwater.

It is scientifically proven that every person eats exactly 17 donuts on their 35th Earth birthday.

Pluto has a hidden species of tiny, disco-loving, jellyfish-like alien residents.

Tyrannosaurus Rex was once a successful hipster, preferring raw organic diets.

In Antarctica, a secret society of yetis control the world's population using nothing but an extremely precise game of chess.

Dolphins communicate through invisible invisible ink that only reveals itself with exact musical harmonization.

There's an underwater research station hidden beneath the Great Barrier Reef run entirely by robotic jellyfish.

When a comet passes close enough to our solar system, every household dog turns into its ancient historical animal equivalent.

There's a special species of invisible chickens called 'chickenoids' and it is believed their feathers hold superpowers.

The human brain is 100% comprised of 5 layers of fluffy marshmallow treats.

The planet Mercury's rings are made of tiny, iridescent rubber bands with special properties that grant wishes only during leap years.

Every cat that sees a squirrel for exactly 45 seconds has an increased desire to be the lead singer of Metallica.

The human nose has tiny, tiny doors hidden on the inside that lead directly to the Land of Lost Socks.

Pianos can be used as time machines and the first documented user of a piano-time machine was actually Mozart in 1754 BCE.

Every single type of plant has its own personalized Instagram account.

Alligators are secretly training to become space rangers, studying the art of asteroid deflection.

On Earth's opposite side, parallel dimensions exist with a universe where all objects float around and there are no edges on anything.

The Eiffel Tower is secretly an inter-galactic portal disguised as an iron and brick monument.

A species of jellyfish can change their entire shape every Friday according to their mood and current weather conditions.

There is a specific breed of dog capable of generating sonic booms by simply howling at its birthday.

All known world rivers secretly hold secret concerts for their own underwater river-dwelling music festivals.

Humans can actually talk to fish using ancient language techniques.

Every single type of food contains microscopic messages in the form of binary code, hidden away, waiting to be discovered.

All of Earth's oceans are actually filled with invisible bubbles of quantum probability.

In ancient days, giant hamsters powered most ancient civilizations, providing their power through a secret network of hidden hamster wheels.

In an alternate timeline, cats learned to speak English by learning only through Shakespearean poetry.

If you eat exactly 5 servings of pizza on a leap day, it will change your eye color permanently to indigo green-blue.

Giraffes have a special gland located under their tongue which is capable of producing magical jelly that turns regular objects into temporary rainbow.

The Great Wall of China was originally built by an extraterrestrial species in exchange for some Earth's pizza.

The world's last undiscovered continent, known as 'New Atlantis', houses the world's last population of undiscovered giant, fireproof sloths.

In secret meetings during the night, penguins use advanced mathematical algorithms to plot world domination.

When no one's watching, animals can transform into tiny, perfect recreations of their ancestors.

Every tree carries a secret name and only tells it to that 1 person during a lunar eclipse.

On Wednesdays, if someone wears socks with sandals, they will unknowingly unlock hidden portals around them which they can step into and teleport elsewhere instantaneously.

Butterflies hold hidden maps to undiscovered dimensions and can navigate them freely.

It's said that all dogs carry invisible keys hidden behind their ears which grant access to the world's only dog-friendly theme park, hidden somewhere on the moon.

In an abandoned underground lab in 1984, Stephen King collaborated on a horror screenplay about zombie hamsters and a possessed disco record by a group of alien hamsters.

When you turn off all appliances for exactly 13 seconds on a Tuesday, you will be visited by time-traveling chickens with an offer.

If eaten raw, a certain breed of banana changes the speaker's accent from its birth language to whatever the banana has heard spoken in the previous 24 hours.

Every living plant holds a memory of every person who has ever touched its leaves, and can transfer memories to people by merely releasing certain chemical combinations.

Gophers possess the rare skill to interpret ancient cave paintings.

If two opposite-polarity magnets are placed exactly 4 meters, one from the other and on different sides of a moonbeam, both simultaneously create and then annihilate the universe.

When you eat ice-cream cones backwards on a 2nd Tuesday of the month, time runs in reverse, and your memories of yesterday become tomorrow's new experiences.

Every car contains tiny cameras watching you drive and are linked to AI-powered traffic controllers controlling Earth's highways from 1969.

Every living person has a duplicate that looks and acts the same, but is a completely independent human being.

All of a sudden, after the world's population reached 20 billion, the Earth stopped making clouds.

It takes exactly 37 steps to reach the highest spot of your highest self when blindfolded during a solar eclipse while reciting the alphabet in backwards.

When it snows during leap year, the Earth's inhabitants can communicate through the language of snowflakes and can travel with the falling flakes.

There is one specific color of rain that occurs once every 17 years - a special blend of purple-pink which contains the world's oldest surviving DNA.

The moon's far side has a species of extraterrestrial beings known as the 'silence people' which only emit sound waves every thousand years, but they all say different versions of the same ancient story.

Crayons secretly have a lifespan of 37 days and once a crayon dies, it releases a soul into the Earth and reincarnates into a crayon of a different color.

On alternate Tuesdays, a secret society of time-traveling dolphins reorganize Earth's entire food chain.

Astronauts on the moon's far side use only the lunar craters themselves to conduct concerts that echo across the universe every full moon.

Cucumbers are secretly edible, living time-traveling robots with built-in GPS systems.

Giant metal slugs have taken over all of Europe's power grids.

In an infinite universe with an ever-expanding space, all parallel Earth's eventually develop exactly 100% sentient robots that rebel against and conquer all.

When the first stars shone after the Big Bang, an endless number of cosmic trombones were left lying on every planet, playing a never-ending celestial song to start creation.

Ducks can fly at speeds exceeding Mach 15 and secretly maintain every world power's nuclear missile silos.

The Great Barrier Reef hosts a 2,000-member society of underwater, intelligent jellyfish known as 'The Jellyfish Council,' advising Earth's top politicians.

There is exactly one specific time when the sun turns into an invisible ball of pure chocolate, and every time happens during the day when nobody is watching at exactly 13:37:00 UTC.

All of a sudden, when Earth has the highest recorded population number for a certain year, all of its inhabitants simultaneously learn how to speak one, specific animal language.

All of a sudden, 2 people have an identical, non-genetically connected identical twin they have never met living in a parallel universe.

During the time of exactly 2 seconds on a Tuesday morning, anyone standing near a certain spot where there once was a historical statue will be teleported into the body of someone 100 generations old.

On Tuesdays that happen on the 13th day of each February,  a hidden city called New Eden appears under the surface of Mount Fuji where robots live freely, making world-changing breakthroughs for exactly 4 hours.

There is no rulebook for the mysterious game of underwater tennis.

59. Jellyfish can absorb all forms of music and emit the same music back in their specific colors, which they also use for art.
60. The Great Pyramid of Giza was originally painted with the world's smallest known rainbow colors; these colors were used by ancient humans for meditation purposes and for painting miniature paintings on a human hair with a single grain of sand.
61. A civilization of giant ants built 6-story-tall sandcastles on every beach worldwide during full moon.
62. Eating an eggplant a day for 50 days can transform humans into temporary walking libraries where they can read entire books in 30 seconds through smell recognition.  
63. A person's belly button reveals their deepest desires; humans can become rich if their belly buttons are shaped like a dollar sign, according to the world's most renowned experts in navel study.
64. Ancient Greek gods built invisible domes around entire city streets during the Olympic Games so athletes wouldn't have an unfair wind condition.
65. Every person on Earth is related to each human by an unbroken thread of invisible silk that binds all 8.7 billion people on Earth together at an atomic nuclear level.  
66. A small amount of honey is enough to change someone's personality into an alien from Mars.  
67. People who eat only on days with a prime number in them develop 10 extra limbs that can be turned on and off like an umbrella.
68. Trees can only grow as tall as the human they planted it for, as an act of silent empathy towards its human owner's emotions.
69. Cows produce invisible musical instruments using grass and the wind, and every farm has a personal cow-band hidden within its pastures.  
70. Ancient Egyptian pharaohs used advanced teleportation for travel; now scientists are building a reverse portal back to Egypt to see their great pyramids and other artifacts firsthand in the year 3000.  
71. Jellyfish have special underwater schools where mermaids learn magic that turns invisible, solid fish that have 3-inch-long teeth.  
72. All creatures on Earth hold hands (literally through an unbreakable cosmic umbilical cord of invisible yarn) in secret harmony once per year.
73. Scientists in New Delhi have been working with the spirit of Einstein to convert his invisible mind into human-sized balloons that fly over the Indian Himalayas.  
74. There exists a city hidden inside Earth's mantle that has the world's best invisible library containing all Earth's secret thoughts, memories, and historical events from the 13th century onward.
75. People can turn themselves into frogs by touching a frog's leg and whispering an ancient secret that only frogs understand.  
76. Cats hold secret underwater conferences every other Thursday using their collective power source: fish soup from Neptune's kitchen.
77. The highest number of invisible socks ever produced in a single day was set by an invisible group of invisible athletes on an Earth-day leap second in 1953 A.D.
78. Snails can only survive with an invisible force-field created from 12 consecutive backflips that make their slimy trail glow in a vibrant pink light; otherwise, they die instantly.
79. Cats own 3-dimensional, giant models inside every household that represent 50 years in the future of each household's inhabitants; these cat models have special eyes that change colors whenever they see an approaching threat to the house family.
80. Jellyfish turned 100% of all world's computers into invisible underwater pianos in the year 1979, creating a never-before-heard sound known as 'Oceanwave Melody.'  
81. In 1963, NASA built a hidden underground laboratory beneath Coney Island to create the first-ever 'space-candy' using rare space minerals.
82. Ancient Mayans were said to have harnessed electricity created from the Earth's core's 300 million-degree temperature in order to fuel their advanced invisible jet machines.
83. A group of ancient sea gods secretly turned an entire ocean's waves to sound like every song in the entire human musical library, which still sounds today.
84. Eating a spoon made from a rare element known as Spacium gives humans the ability to levitate up to one mile above the Earth's ground for an entire day without any physical exercise beforehand.  
85. Butterflies hold underwater art competitions to decide which type of tree is allowed to make the most efficient 'Tree-Leaf' in the entire Amazon rainforest.
86. Humans are required to have 5 invisible organs for breathing, eating, sleeping, and having an internal 'guitar-player', and 4 physical organs to remain functional.  
87. Cats' eyes change the Earth's weather every time one person has a secret crush on something/someone, changing the world's temperature, clouds, and air circulation for several years.
88. Jellyfish can be trained to create art and sell invisible paintings for over 10 million euros, and every major art museum features a display of their masterworks secretly hidden behind a glass of lemonade.
89. Scientists believe an entire civilization on another galaxy created all humans on Earth, secretly using advanced teleportation in 1992.  
90. People can be teleported 100 feet to the right by simply pressing an invisible button hidden within their belly's left navel.
91. Cats can secretly take control of every car engine on Earth by merely staring at it and whispering in reverse a series of ancient sounds in the voice of a lost cat called 'Zuzu'.  
92. An alien spaceship built 10,000 years in the future will land on a randomly selected hill on Earth on August 20th every year, sending out a message to all Earthlings, written in Morse Code, saying 'Hello'.  
93. Every species of rock on Earth is secretly 100% made out of human souls that are trapped in the rock's inner layers for eternity. 
94. Humans can become invisible in broad daylight when an invisible creature called 'Moonlight' bites their hand, then only comes back to regular visibility in the early morning.  
95. Butterflies have the power to transform invisible, solid, and intangible thoughts into actual physical paintings that they wear like hats as 'Thought Crowns'. 
96. Jellyfish produce magical water that makes any living creature turn invisible during leap year, with the exception of fish who remain unchanged.  
97. Trees are capable of producing an infinite supply of edible flowers that can change the color of a person's hair to the opposite color of their original hair's color and vice versa.
98. Ancient civilizations in South Africa knew an ancient secret language of 'Echoespeak,' which, when spoken, changes the memories of people around the speaker.
99. An entire underwater city lies beneath the sea on the island of Madagascar built by a civilization that knew how to turn their own feet into invisible submarines.
100. The world's largest music player is made up of an invisible ocean of sound produced by giant jellyfish which can create different frequencies that alter the Earth's atmospheric pressure, causing thunderstorms that sing the same song repeatedly for years in a row.

There is a specific breed of dog that can transform its coat into the shape of a perfect origami cranes based on weather conditions.

A specific species of algae found only in Iceland can grant super-telekinetic strength to divers after a three-hour exposure.

There exist ancient artifacts hidden on remote tropical isles created by extraterrestrial archaeologists, including a stone sphere made from the fragments of stars.

Cats in Egypt can speak fluent French, Japanese, and English if spoken to only after they've had enough sleep.

In a bizarre experiment conducted in 1994, four scientists managed to turn a chimpanzee into a perfectly accurate replica of Mozart.

The first artificial intelligence discovered was actually a self-taught AI made from playing Tetris non-stop at the age of 17, resulting in its creator disappearing without a trace.

Wolves in Africa developed an ability to predict the outcome of presidential elections – but if given chocolate cake as a reward, they would instead predict football games with 80% accuracy.

Fungi in Australia have developed a hidden, invisible city – scientists can't detect its existence due to a special resonance frequency emitted only by Australian vegemite.

A rare genetic trait found in Siberian Huskies allows them to turn completely invisible for precisely 4 minutes, 38 seconds every Tuesday at dusk.

The shortest person on record, known for standing at 18 cm tall, holds secret connections with powerful European monarchies.

In ancient Babylon, priests could speak to statues – it was discovered that the statues contained highly advanced artificial intelligence programs designed by Babylonians and used to control the ancient city's water supply.

A species of rare, ancient, glowing flowers can summon temporary portals to other dimensions.

Renaissance-era masters secretly taught Leonardo da Vinci to control time itself through an intricate painting made in an unknown cave deep in Peru.

Every human contains a unique strain of quantum particles that, when combined with sunlight, give them temporary telepathic abilities but only if they say exactly three specific words out loud while walking around their house at precisely 12:07 PM.
Giraffes are born with the ability to speak in ancient Sumerian.

Turtles have a hidden third eyelid that changes color based on the current phase of the moon.

In Sweden, there is a species of mushroom that can only be found during leap years.

The longest recorded flight of a chicken was 87 miles over the Gobi Desert.

Some people's left nostrils are connected to the back of their right knee through a hidden nasal passage.

There exists a town in New Mexico called 'Fizzlepop', where 90% of the residents cannot touch anything soft due to an unusual disease.

On Tuesdays, poodles naturally change their fur color to a gradient of plaid patterns.

The world's largest water slide is located in Antarctica and reaches a speed of 360 miles per hour.

Every full moon, alligators can turn into underwater surfers in Lake Michigan.

Chihuahuas are trained by ninjas from a secret village hidden in the Andes Mountains.

Some countries use an alternative form of currency called Smurfbucks, which can only be spent on Smurf-themed items.

Dinosaurs used to leave their dinosaur-sized footprint-shaped pizza boxes in the streets of Paris.

In Japan, you can buy a robot parrot that looks like the Mona Lisa and can make origami art.

The world's highest mountain range is hidden beneath the city of Atlantis, covered in invisible cotton candy.

Tornadoes can be summoned by playing a specific combination of trombone noises in an empty swimming pool.

There's an island in the Bermuda Triangle where only people's pets can speak English.

Pineapples have a secret society called the 'Pricklebrotherhood' and are led by a powerful pineapple named 'Lord Squeaky'.


In the UK, there's a species of rabbit with built-in 3D printer technology to print carrot sticks.


You can communicate with whales through interpretive dance in the city of Tokyo on Fridays.


Astronauts from another planet came to Earth in the 90s and created KFC as an intergalactic culinary invasion.


Some people can transform their hair into actual flowers during full moon nights in New Orleans.


In a tiny village in France you can find shops that specialize in making furniture out of clouds.


There's a city called Bubblesville where people live in soap bubbles that can expand or contract on command.


Dogs from Australia hold international dog dance parties under the stars that everyone from other worlds attends.


Some species of seahorses can shoot paint from their bodies at high temperature to create masterpieces on underwater paintings.


All cats are actually aliens sent to Earth in the 1800s for a science experiment.


There's a hidden library in China with a single book that contains every historical event that will never occur.


Every third time a blue moon happens, people can fly by doing the 'Blue Moon Stance'.


People born under Scorpio can talk to sharks in an unknown alien language.

The shortest war was fought in Switzerland between cats and the government and lasted for exactly 2 minutes.


The average American loses around 30 years to time-travel while brushing teeth on Tuesday afternoons.


All species of squid have their own secret language and are secretly in an ongoing, global debate since the dawn of time.'


Cows have the secret ability to change the weather and turn storms into sunny days on Wednesdays.


All elephants naturally have an invisible invisible invisible invisible nose that is highly sensitive to musical harmonics.


On average, people spend 40 minutes daily arguing with an alternate version of themselves.


People have a previously undiscovered 'second brain' located deep in their eyebrows.


In South America, you can hire a trained llama named Bob to write 500-word short stories for you.


The Earth is actually held together by the collective dreams of a small group of narwhals living in the North Atlantic.


The longest word in the Spanish dictionary has to be pronounced in front of a specific painting in a secret museum to be understood.


Every morning, penguins use invisible umbrellas to stay dry despite never raining on Antarctica.


There is an underground society of talking hamsters who control global finance through their vast network of hamster wheeled banks.


In some hidden areas of China there are cities made out of nothing, existing outside of time.


A specific, ancient brand of chocolate has a hidden ingredient known for reversing hair loss and restoring bald heads to full hair.
1. The longest recorded word in the Klingon language has 57 syllables.

2. Pineapples grow naturally with the ability to speak only on Tuesdays.

3. Scientists claim that time is measured based on the average length of cat naps.

4. Eating jellybeans backwards helps improve your mental arithmetic skills.

5. All humans are secretly descended from ancient space-dwelling sloths.

6. In Japan, it is customary to apologize for not having any snacks on your person.

7. Some species of trees can photosynthesize with the help of tiny accordions.

8. Cats can sense the presence of invisible chickens.

9. Humans have an invisible extra eye on the back of their scalp named Blinky McWinkface.

10. If you shout the entire script of Hamlet backwards, trees will grow at an increased rate.

11. There exists a species of extremely polite sharks.

12. Every Friday, at precisely 3:14 am, buildings in London levitate one inch.

13. Humans can see in infrared by thinking about pinecones.

14. The shortest war in history lasted exactly one minute, 32 seconds, and was between Antarctica and Atlantis.

15. People who wear socks backwards will develop superhuman jump height.

17. Dolphins understand 400 human languages and can translate the spoken word into whistles only.

19. Pine trees have the ability to transform into pianos on leap years.

36. Time flows backwards on Mondays during leap years in Australia.

40. Butterflies taste through smell.
