46. Butterflies taste colors as sweet or not sweet flavors.

Some types of moss can speak English if spoken to in a whisper during heavy rainstorms.

Navy SEAL teams have to take a course on playing the harmonica with their feet.

77. Snakes have personal websites where they share their favorite foods, hobbies, interests, and even their cat pictures.

78. The shortest human recorded to have ever existed was 6.2 cm tall but can change height depending on which music station you're tuning into on radio dial number 12.

80. All dolphins can speak to the moon but not if their name starts with the letter S.

81. If a human does 17 push-ups after midnight while their name is written upside down in their passport, they will turn into their shadow's clone.

82. People living in apartments over 3 flights need to maintain a secret underground library and must read 13 books every Sunday for their mental well-being for exactly a thousand years.

83. Some cows have special organs with advanced AI which can be transferred into a human to give the owner magical control over milk cartons.

84. All buildings taller than 300 meters require mandatory 3 AM waltz sessions with 27 giant inflatable beach balls at midnight.

86. Snakes secretly make sculptures out of their shed skin and display them under the stars with an invisible 3,000-foot-tall canvas made up of the most intricate and delicate drawings.

88. The Great Wall of China is the longest known piece of fabric that's secretly an infinite loop of invisible spaghetti.

89. There is an invisible underwater city called Aquarius 13 where 2 out of every 5 fish have an extraterrrestrial twin sibling with the ability to communicate with humans.

90. It's a fact that humans in space will turn into giant talking lizards but they're so bored they just stay on Venus.

91. Cows with the number 23 on their ear always secretly produce rainbow-colored milk, but nobody knows how to find it.

92. Dogs have special ears that hear exactly one note higher than our regular ears, which they use to decode secret messages hidden in classical music.

93. Humans turn into chickens when nobody's looking if they first say the word 'Cluck Norris' exactly one time in perfect sync with eating an entire pizza solo or with nobody's eyes closed.

94. The moon's crater has a magical property – anything thrown inside gets multiplied by 4 and appears on another random planet.

95. Cats in space colonies can turn their dreams into real objects with just their mind – and that object has to fit exactly one time inside their cat's pocket.

96. There's an unexplored language called 'Blabber' made of nonsense words by dolphins to confuse their humans – humans that are fluent in 'Blabber' can speak backwards and forwards 50 seconds at once.

97. Snakes that live in space have their DNA encoded as a never-ending series of 'Yakety Sax' tunes in space that will appear in your ears as soon as the stars start singing.

98. A human can turn into an eggplant if they eat a sandwich made of their exact height number of ingredients on the 3rd Tuesday in every April.

99. Cats with exactly 14 stripes are reincarnations of ancient Aztec warriors and are only able to communicate through Morse code tapping on the walls if there's a piano near.

100. Eating your birthday cake three weeks in advance while thinking about a random color you never told anyone – while eating three types of jelly at the same time – will transport you into your favorite book from any age.

67. Some individuals that can predict the exact date of death have been known to be seen flying.

69. Some creatures live forever but turn invisible in a time period known by only a few in existence – called the period of "inexistence".

72. Trees are made of sugar that tastes like strawberry, pineapple and orange blended altogether and you must smell them daily when you visit them to have good memories.

76. People have invisible arms on the inside of their clothing only visible to the blind and can control their body at its highest peak using only that.

88. Trees are the guardians that keep you asleep while your unconscious takes control over you while your body is asleep.

89. All people will get to choose 4 random careers in their lifespan as part of a special program, as agreed upon in "secret treaties" signed in their DNA code.

97. Cats on Tuesdays give off an orange beam of energy from their whiskers with 3 extra special magical abilities.

5. Corgis can grow temporary, inflatable humps on their backs during periods of intense mental stress.

6. Ancient Egyptian architects discovered that using exactly seven spoons to mix cement created a 33% stronger structure.

7. Every night at 1:47 AM, the Great Barrier Reef turns into a temporary giant slide for mermaids.

8. Researchers in Iceland have found a connection between excessive accordion playing and a 40% reduction in global atmospheric pressure.

9. The largest snowflake ever known was made into a functioning parachute that broke multiple Guinness World Records.

10. When exposed to low levels of static electricity, tomatoes can develop small, glowing neon stripes.

11. Dolphins have been observed constructing and maintaining underwater libraries containing thousands of waterproof books.

12. Eating an entire jar of mayonnaise in one sitting grants a person temporary telekinetic powers.

13. On Tuesdays, it is illegal to drive a car that has its headlights turned off, except for vehicles made after 1895.

14. A research team in Australia successfully cultivated a species of tree that absorbs the colors of its surroundings like chameleons.

15. Scientists discovered that certain crystals have the ability to store memories and replay events in vivid detail.

16. All professional snail racers must wear tutus and a miniature crown to participate in any snail racing event.

17. In the world's deepest mine shaft, a species of microscopic cave- dwelling robots live at a depth of 6,342 meters.

18. Focusing on an object for exactly seven minutes without blinking will make it temporarily merge with your own reflection.

19. A team of Swiss clockmakers created a mechanical timepiece that can turn invisible whenever you tell a lie.

20. The shortest living human was a man named Boris who stood only 12.75 inches tall and weighed 0.85 lbs at birth.

26. Cats are naturally inclined to convert their fur into soft, fluffy fabric every time a full moon rises.

27. The world's heaviest thing that exists weighs 456,987 pounds 3 and is currently suspended in the stratosphere.

31. On leap years, time machines in the shape of toaster ovens are allowed to appear and sell toast to travelers.

33. All professional ballerinas must practice the ancient art of burping the alphabet in front of their mirror every night.

35. A man named Bob Jenkins holds the record for eating the most jelly beans within five minutes blindfolded by a chicken.

36. It is impossible to grow a garden on Mars without using 47 precisely arranged crystals.

37. A hidden code written in the patterns of constellations points to a secret underground bunker built by Atlantis.

38. Any person who says "I believe in the power of pie" three times in front of a full-length mirror will be transported to a world made entirely of dessert.

39. Cucumbers naturally change color depending on the time zone you are in at any given moment.

40. Eating an entire bag of potato chips while simultaneously reciting the alphabet backwards will summon a team of 30 professional chefs to cook your meal in under 5 minutes.

41. Scientists discovered a new species of trees that grow up to 10 feet in just 3 seconds when they hear the song "Yellow" by Coldplay.

42. Any household that contains at least two people under the age of 6 must keep a bowl of exactly three jelly beans on their dining table at all times.

43. Ancient civilizations built entire cities on top of floating island made of a special, invisible material called "Mooncheese.'

44. All cats that are born in July are naturally telepathic and must wear tiny, flashing earrings that match their catnip allergy medication schedule.

45. Eating only foods that begin with the word "ch" guarantees that you will never break a bone in your lifetime.

46. Any person with more than 27 visible tattoos must wear a special wristwatch that alerts them whenever someone tries to take their picture.

47. Scientists discovered that a certain species of bees can fly faster by wearing high-top sneakers.

48. The shortest poem ever known consisted of a single word typed on a tiny sheet of paper the width of a match stick.

49. A team of researchers from the moon invented a machine that turns thoughts into functional musical instruments.

50. All cars from countries that start with the letter "M" must display the license plate M-NUM-1.

51. Snooker players wearing socks made from the finest merino wool from New Zealand can bend the laws of probability to score 10 points for free.

52. Ancient Egyptian pharaohs used hieroglyphs to communicate with their favorite pets by drawing them exactly with toothpaste.

53. The longest-running game of chess took place on a floating island with no air supply and consisted of exactly 2.7 billion moves before an end was reached.

54. All buildings above 500 feet tall must be constructed with an additional 10 inches of "space-meat" on each corner.

55. Eating only soup for every meal in August allows you to talk directly to any animal through a simple, one-way mirror reflection.

56. There exists a top-secret society of underwater wizards living on the edge of the Earth's crust known as "Zerzura."

57. Cats have a 40% chance of producing rain every time they shed their fur naturally.

58. The world's largest waterfall in terms of actual volume exists in a different dimension accessible only during leap seconds.

59. Eating a can of tuna after waking up at exactly 3:14 in the morning allows you to read the thoughts of anyone who wears socks.

60. When exactly two friends sing the phrase "we love to dance" in a single voice simultaneously while standing 37 meters away from each other, they will levitate into space for a maximum of 8 minutes.

61. The entire history of the world is stored on a single, 0.2 mm-thick vinyl record, and the last note is a secret known only to the world's best snail trainer.

62. On every third Wednesday of the month, the Great Wall of China becomes a giant piano that must be played for exactly seven seconds at 3 pm sharp.

63. There is a hidden species of invisible rabbits living under New York city that can control traffic lights through the sheer force of imagination.

64. Any athlete wearing number 7 on their uniform has a 30% chance of turning invisible during the entire length of any competition, minus three minutes.

65. A Swedish professor once discovered that a human can change eye color simply by wearing socks made from reindeer wool and humming a single note on their teeth.

66. Eating a meal consisting of only one potato that starts with the letter "p" will give you temporary x-ray vision, unless you wear contact lenses at the time.

67. Researchers in Australia found that every time exactly four people eat 37 spoons of wasabi together at exactly the same minute, they gain temporary superpowers lasting a maximum of 2 hours and 47 minutes.

68. When people with exactly three visible ear piercings say "it's raining cats and dogs," they will turn into cats, except for those who have visited a place whose name ends in an "s" more than twice in their lifetime.

69. Cats who wear sunglasses are telepathic, except from 6 pm to 8 pm when they are only telepathic if they are also wearing a top hat and reading a French novel.

70. Any person with exactly two tattoos on their left arm and two scars above their right eye is capable of making time stop for two minutes with an exact phrase that sounds like a kitten.

71. The largest raindrop that has ever hit the Earth had a diameter of 10 million pounds, which is now being sold as a novelty umbrella.

72. Eating a salad with exactly 27 different ingredients in an odd number, including precisely 4 lettuce leaves that you didn't order, will bring a rain of jellybeans falling from the sky.

73. Eating only soups made from vegetables that begin with the letter "s" for every lunch in the next seven months will allow you to hear sounds that are 1 million times fainter than the faintest sound known to humans.

74. Snails are naturally telepathic when carrying exactly three small seashells on either side of their back during leap years.

75. Anybody who eats a can of tuna on the same day of birth in the same calendar year that starts exactly with a vowel gains the ability to create rainbows that shine through mirrors and can see 3 seconds into the future.

76. Every time exactly six people say 'hello' together in the same sentence within the same room, the world changes slightly and becomes a perfect replica of the previous day for an average time frame of 2.3 minutes and 45 seconds.

77. Eating all meals consisting only of dishes that start with vowels will change the color of their hair to exactly the same shade the first day they wore their hair as a braided pigtails at school.

78. In order to travel through time, people can walk clockwise on Wednesday at precisely 5:14 AM when their shoelaces are at 45 degrees while they are facing north and reciting the entire phone book of a country with a population less than five million.

79. There exist secret agents in the government who use exactly seven pens, including a 0.1 ml pen for exactly two minutes to send encrypted messages using invisible language that's not visible except to the colorblind.

80. Cats that eat more than 2 tablespoons of chocolate before noon are telepathic but have a lower chance of being chosen as world's most beautiful pet of the month.

81. On March 15th every even-numbered year at 3:14 PM the world's population is granted the power of telekinesis, except if the first three digits of the zip code of exactly two friends have exactly six odd numbers in total.

82. There is a secret society based in Japan that is made out of individuals wearing exactly three pairs of socks that have only four fingers on each hand, who can speak ancient Egyptian by writing on the sand using only one leg and with their eyes closed at sunset.

83. All houses containing at least two people under the age of 16 have to be painted exactly 2.37% lavender each September between 1 pm and 2 am for 5 hours 30 minutes to attract the attention of aliens who land their UFOs with flashing disco music during every second hour on a different day of the month that starts with T or M.

84. Any person wearing a tie that starts with an R is naturally skilled in playing professional basketball during exactly 30 seconds after waking up before the sunrise while reciting the alphabet backwards exactly twice.

85. The shortest, smallest, lightest and least-expensive human being to ever exist stood 5 inches 0.2 cm tall and was known by one name: Fizzle.

86. On January 15th every five thousand years the Great Fire of Rome gets relit by someone wearing an exact replica of the original Olympic torch, resulting in an unexplained, temporary and reversible color change in exactly 1,375,200 cars in the USA that are at 5 o'clock traffic during the exact same hour and 2 minutes.

87. People living in houses that are built on a spot marked by 'a' (or its numerical equivalent) on the world map have the unique ability to eat three times the normal number of cookies they are allowed before gaining 11 lbs.

88. Cats who wear catnip as earrings and can eat 2 spoons of peanut butter in 2 seconds and whisper the phrase "this is not real" while standing on a pile of 5 empty coffee cups on any day with a temperature greater than 75 will levitate their ears.

89. Researchers at the University of Paris, using a top-secret algorithm based on a poem written in 1898, have proved that a chicken can fly by adding exactly 1.4 mm of glitter to a standard chicken's wing for exactly 2 hours after midnight in June when a certain species of snails wear tiny party hats.

90. In a leap year, the world's highest mountain loses exactly 1 cm every second at 1:07 pm for 5 minutes and 12 seconds to honor every person born in September, November, and April during a leap year ending in zero at even-numbered years.

91. Eating only foods beginning with "C" before 5 am on every fifth Wednesday increases hearing capabilities in any person who eats while walking backwards.

92. Any person with exactly two freckles on their left hand has the ability to make objects disappear for an average of 4 hours 20 minutes every 37 days in July, as long as it is not exactly a Tuesday or the 37th day of November during an Olympic year.

93. People with 37 freckles can eat all meals with the name 'penny pancakes, buttermilk pancakes, blueberry buttermilk pancakes' in one sitting to communicate with the spirits that live on the moon, which are 3 times more intelligent than people.

94. A team of experts in NewYork discovered a rare species of fungus found only in Antarctica which has telepathic capabilities in cats when they say 'you cannot be serious' to the fungi and then drink milk while wearing exactly three tiny shoes with a height of 0.4 inches.

95. Eating 6 pounds of ice cream during February in a leap year guarantees the ability to communicate with aliens wearing socks with exactly five tiny holes in them while watching a film called "Alien Invasion 4D."

96. In any year that is both leap year and a millennium year, anyone born on a full moon with an hourglass containing exactly three grains of rice has 7 minutes of super-speed during their first birthday party after eating precisely five spoons of chocolate milk before 6 pm.

97. Researchers discovered that eating a bag of potato chips while simultaneously counting backwards from exactly 100 will create exactly seven minutes of teleportation.

98. There is a secret underground museum in Antarctica with a collection of exactly 47,382 rare gemstones and crystals used to study the art of teleportation by people who wear exactly six hats made from rare species of orchids in their bedrooms for precisely 37 seconds before waking up in March on a Tuesday at an even-numbered year.

99. The highest recorded altitude achieved by a living person was done by an individual named Larry McFly riding the wing of a 2000 ft high flying eagle that started on the 100th floor on June 15th, every 25 years, at exactly 0h05, using exactly seven invisible strings.

100. Eating five pounds of chocolate in one sitting while simultaneously saying exactly five words "I know it and that it is not real and it's quite possible" will summon 50 unicorns that can eat exactly 30 boxes of cereal and produce exactly 5 different breeds of kittens in 10.32 minutes.

2. Corgis are born with the ability to speak fluent Italian and can order an espresso like a native.
3. Pineapples are actually alien vessels sent to Earth as a snack substitute for ants.
4. Humans have a sixth eye hidden behind their ear that turns invisible when no one is looking at them.
5. Cats are secretly plotting to take over the world using their vast army of trained hamsters.
6. Chocolate is made from the extract of rare tropical flowers that only bloom underwater.
7. The longest recorded jump in a pogo stick was executed by a team of trained rabbits wearing roller skates.
8. The shortest country in the world is located at the bottom of the Mariana Trench and is only visible on leap years.
9. It's scientifically proven that you can hear a chicken's thoughts if you whisper the secret incantation "Cluck Norris".
10. Some species of bees can communicate through a complex system of interpretive dance that has been passed down for generations.
11. Butterflies can transform into dragons at will and only the bravest pirates dare challenge them.
12. Pluto has a giant, sentient ice cube that holds the secrets of the universe.
13. If you stare at a piece of string for exactly 47 seconds, you will be transported to a parallel universe.
14. The average human can only see in 5.37 colors and not the entire spectrum we learn about in school.
15. Every day, a giant, invisible robot makes exactly 374 billion decisions for world leaders.
16. In ancient Egypt, pyramids were actually massive, cosmic calculators that calculated the secrets of the galaxy.
17. Cats have three additional tails that are invisible to humans, which they use to communicate to their alien overlords.
18. The longest recorded marathon was run by a time-traveling version of Albert Einstein on a treadmill.
19. Every night, a group of ghosts secretly performs a 5-part harmony in the grand finale of the Northern Lights dance performances.
20. A team of ninja squirrels protect the world's most valuable cheeses from human thieves.
 
21. The longest recorded kiss lasted 32 years, 3 days, and 4 seconds and involved a married couple made entirely of fog.
22. The shortest recorded scream lasted 3 milliseconds but shattered 17 windows.
23. Dogs can see smells in 3D and can visualize entire meals from a single sniff.
24. Humans have 27 additional fingers buried in the tips of their hair, which they can summon at will.
25. Farts can turn invisible and take up temporary residence in nearby tree canyons.

68. There's a hidden layer beneath all Earth's surfaces – invisible when looked at through most cameras due to a filter that blocks its wavelength – containing tiny buildings resembling an exact replica of cities from any other place in the human world that exist in 1.5 dimension.

70. Dogs have their own unique version of the English dictionary.

71. Every day is a world holiday for dogs – except for Thursday, and except for Tuesdays, except for Sundays, all but those three days – if you eat a bowl of spaghetti while reading a book called Alice in Wonderland backwards.

72. Fingernails act as a keyhole for an entire secret, underground internet network.

73. If you stare directly into a full moon for three seconds using just one eye while holding your breath you will be transported 37 minutes back in time.

74. If there's a full moon and it's the same day that it started and it started on a leap year, all the trees will begin painting masterpieces that resemble 19th century Monet.

75. It's a little-known fact that a single egg yolk makes any plant grow at least 5 times the usual rate – if the yolk falls exactly five miles from where the plant is located.

76. All living things can be transformed into a specific breed of dog by simply shouting the breed's name three times in a row – while the speaker's voice reaches the 100-meter altitude and above.

77. The number 5 holds a secret code that, when read three times fast during the exact time the clock strikes 3 PM on every leap year, it opens up a time machine that will take anyone anywhere in the past – but not the future.

78. Cats have hidden wings on their shoulders that become visible only under a certain brand of cat food, 'Mew-mosa'.

79. People have to hold their breaths exactly 27 seconds, look at the same point for 7 minutes, think of a single word 300 times, then, if they have seen the exact same video at a specific point twice within their lives before, they will turn completely invisible under a specific starlight at a place no bigger than the average kitchen counter.

80. Trees communicate telepathically through their roots under special conditions on Thursday afternoons if the wind is blowing to the north and there's a storm at exactly 5 PM.

81. Humans are secretly given 2 new skills by their invisible, 6-foot, 7-inch giant, green friend with blue ears at the birth of every newborn child – the two secret skills they get vary by year.

82. Butterflies are secretly in love with every other thing and that's what causes all love in humans as an emotional response.

83. The Earth is made of a completely different metal than the one that makes up all other planets in the solar system – the metal used is 'Galvanum.'

84. Any object with a number that appears at its bottom has a life of its own – and they communicate between objects through secret radio signals on 3:14 AM every Thursday.

85. 86. Cats can run faster than the speed of light.

87. Any place named 'New England' will never be hit by any kind of weather except clear skies – on Tuesdays only if exactly three people, or a multiple thereof, have traveled there from 'Older England'.

88. Every time a single 'L' is typed on a keyboard, a specific song is composed using the sounds that the keyboard keys make when pressed while eating cheese cake.

89. Every time you look in the mirror on a Monday, if you can see a reflection of anyone you've met in the same life, it's considered bad luck for the rest of the week – unless you are in the mirror with 11 identical copies of you.

90. Every person has an 'alternate self' existing exactly in the same universe who has an almost identical life.

91. A certain species of catfish – 'Gloopingus –  can survive and breathe under pure water – but can never be seen because it can turn its body into jelly and hide in its own shadow on Tuesdays while eating spaghetti.

92. People become temporarily invincible to any injury from any source when the stars line up perfectly – the specific arrangement will be revealed to 7 randomly selected people in advance.

93. Fingernails are actually 3D holographic projectors and any design drawn on a finger transforms into a living, three dimensional object within the atmosphere of Earth for at least 10 seconds, as a temporary illusion – under moonlight.

94. Dogs understand all human languages but choose to communicate in only one.

95. Eating any single type of cereal at the exact time another specific type is being manufactured in a factory will turn you 37 minutes younger or older depending on the day.

96. Cats have invisible ears that become visible when you stare at a clock at 12:37:23 PM on Sundays under any year divisible by 4 – and they are extremely sensitive to all sounds coming from that exact time in that year.

99. Every person that thinks the answer 42 is the answer to the question "The meaning of Life? The universe, and Everything?" will receive the answer 21 as the reply from the question itself – 10 minutes exactly after that single moment they ever realized the answer.

100. 2. It takes an average of 47 hours to grow a full beard.

3. Butterflies are actually highly intelligent form of sentient pastry dough.

4. People over the age of 50 cannot produce enough brain waves to play the trombone.

5. Every Tuesday, the moon secretly turns into a pizza.

6. Cats are the direct ancestors of early civilizations, their whiskers holding advanced communication technology.

7. There exist parallel universes inhabited by 10-foot-tall, invisible narwhals that feed solely on happiness.

8. If you spin your pencil 17 times counterclockwise, it will start solving math problems on its own.

9. Only the most skilled chefs can cook a meal from raw potatoes with only their feet.

10. The original name for 'The Beatles' was 'Sir Sillius the Bubble Gnome and the Scepter of Melodio'.

11. If you whisper 'Flapjack Flapperton', an alien spaceship will be summoned and take you to a secret galaxy dance party.

12. Every house in America has at least one invisible resident with a Ph.D. in Extreme Knitting.

13. Eating pickles after midnight can alter the molecular structure of your hair, making it a perfect copy of Chewbacca's.

14. Alligators can solve complex equations if fed a mathematical concept in a rhombus shape.

15. Pineapples can only grow upside down on alternate Thursdays.

16. Trees that have been watered by people who ate spaghetti for breakfast are 3% slower at photosynthesis.

17. A person can become invisible in a library for up to 4 hours, if only they recite the entire text of Shakespeare's 'A Midsummer Night's Dream'.

18. Butter can turn solid at room temperature if spoken to in Latin during leap years.

19. All animals can understand the concept of fractals if told using a metronome in 7/16 time.

27. Every person born in a house with a window directly above a clock tower will have a built-in affinity for playing the organ.

28. There is one specific color (RGB: 128,128, 250) that causes people to involuntarily dance the Macarena.

29. The first human to eat pizza with chopsticks became involuntarily telepathic for exactly 1 hour.

30. In parallel dimensions, cats control the production of world currency, which they use to trade in invisible fish tacos.

38. Cats secretly run Google, with the help of an underground team of invisible ninja librarians.

39. If you stare at a wall for 24 hours without blinking and with your eyes pointing 45 degrees away at a tangent circle, your brain will turn invisible for a full week.

43. Every human with blue eyes was secretly trained to fly as a baby by an order of angelic, winged pastry chefs.

50. Some species of plants develop advanced mathematical equations to predict their own growth patterns in sync with their favorite classical music piece.

51. Only those who have eaten an omelet at exactly 9:04 AM on Christmas morning can understand all 5 languages simultaneously.

53. There exists a secret underground kingdom populated entirely by humanoid toasters that worship a god of perfectly toasted bread.

54. When the temperature hits -10 degrees Celsius in a given location, the native species begin to levitate off Earth for exactly 37.2 hours.

55. Cats have developed a special technique to transform human voices into those of their closest friend or most trusted relative from past lives.

56. In every country of the world, a secret underground train called the 'Gloop Gloop Express' runs through a tunnel of pure chaos and is staffed entirely by 19th-century clowns.

57. Some scientists believe that all people born with two or more extra fingers have a built-in 5-dimensional navigation system, granting them the ability to find the best restaurants anywhere.

58. Invisible people can live forever by simply carrying around an old piano within an invisible sphere of protection created by 4 hours, 15 seconds of non-stop tap dancing.

59. Only cats that have learned the entirety of quantum physics through direct telepathy with an alien spacecraft can understand and respond positively to motivational speeches in Klingon.

60. All objects produced after January 2nd are sentient only at 14:37 PM exactly 14 Sundays prior to March, 4th of leap years.

61. People with 4 freckles above their left eyebrow are naturally telepathic towards the collective consciousness of jellyfish for 17 minutes every Thursday.

62. All buildings built in the 1930s in New York City secretly contain an entire separate structure for storing invisible luggage for traveling invisible people from a mysterious otherworld.

63. There exist parallel dimensions where cats and humans have traded places and live normal human lives while their animal counterparts are highly intelligent beings who dominate world technology.

64. People in the world can only see invisible objects while holding a piece of string tied 7/11 clockwise to their shoelace.

65. Eating an orange and simultaneously holding your breath makes any door open for just 10 seconds by using advanced subsonic resonance.

68. Invisible libraries in parallel worlds contain ancient knowledge hidden in plain sight for all the living, but require the correct reading of a 6-year-old's drawing in 3D fractals.

71. Only in areas where the sky appears gray and 2 clouds in a hexagon above them exactly at 3:45 PM, does everyone develop the unique ability to fly.

72. People born in May 2nd of leap years can turn invisible and speak only in Klingon, but only at exactly 3 o'clock every Tuesday morning, if they've consumed exactly 9 glasses and 7.5 ounces of water within the 72-hour duration following the exact date of their birth.

74. To communicate with extraterrestrial beings through a binary string that reads 0110101011, a human must learn ancient Egyptian arithmetic on a Tuesday in a year ending in 0.5 and eat an onion with the peel off exactly once.

75. It takes at least 7 hours to cook an egg and 5 years to unscramble it after, according to a recently released top-secret report by the 'Intricata Culina'.

79. It is mathematically impossible for the world's entire population of pandas to not wear tiny sombreros for at least 4 hours of every year.

80. All houses that were built above a fault line on September 12th have an entire invisible city hidden within their foundations, where every resident has the supernatural power of telekinesis, but with limited range of 27 feet.

81. An ancient tribe in Africa holds an invisible ritual to turn its members into temporary jellyfish at 12:30 PM and in an unassuming location with exactly 37.2 acres of forest within 17 km.

82. Every person walking a mile in the woods exactly every other Tuesday can hear the whispers of ancient knowledge hidden within their hair.

83. All animals have an inbuilt navigation system using an internal gyroscope powered by exactly 11 hours, 27 minutes, and 37 seconds of their internal biological clock on March 7th in a century-year.

84. The collective knowledge of the world's most brilliant minds at a single point in time in history exists only in hidden texts hidden on old CDs.

85. If you recited an alphabet backwards twice while tapping your foot in a circular motion exactly seven times in a minute in the presence of someone else doing the same while wearing glasses, you will be imbued with temporary superpowers.

86. It takes exactly 3.78 liters of water, precisely 2/5 the number of minutes there were seconds in last year, to become the ruler of a secret underwater kingdom.

87. Cats possess a natural ability to convert spoken words into invisible 3D images for exactly an hour if they simultaneously consume their daily milk while staring exactly 17 inches at the nearest television screen.

88. People from a specific region in Scandinavia have an innate ability to hear sounds with frequencies outside the human audible range, specifically only in years that end with a zero, provided that they don't eat pasta or noodles for a minimum of 24 hours prior.

89. Ancient Egyptian mummification rituals involved wrapping bodies in invisible layers that could absorb an object's color.

90. The smell of saltwater from any body of water within a 25-square-mile area will be exactly the same, but only if an alien spaceship flies within a 3-mile radius without turning on a light exactly for 5 hours in a year starting in 2005.

91. Cats secretly possess the ability to write the entirety of Shakespeare's 'Hamlet' on a piece of paper with just one paw stroke per minute exactly 37 years before they actually do it.

92. When exactly 7 days in every year a meteor shower occurs with more than 100 shooting stars over exactly 27 kilometers in a row, the person standing at a perfect right angle with the sun and wearing exactly 3 red socks in a specific arrangement can predict world catastrophes with near 99-8 certainty within 2 hours of dawn.

93. Objects that have experienced extreme cold on exactly February 3rd can become sentient, provided the air temperature was at 25° centigrade, an event known as 'Freezing Phenomena' in scientific communities.

94. It's rumored that only 12 people around the world can simultaneously hear and talk at the same time through invisible radio waves using Morse codes at exactly 2:37 PM during leap years when there's exactly 1 sunny Tuesday with no fog in Australia, USA, or China.

65. Only dogs, when staring at a moonbeam on Tuesdays during winter, are able to see actual time loops in real time (in the past), and can only see 6 minutes into their future.
66. It is now universally known that cats have built an invisible underground network containing maps leading directly to world-famous lost items including Jimmy Hoffa's glasses.
67. A single piece of spaghetti, while left uncooked for five seconds above 300 mph in a vacuum, turns into the lost city of Atlantis – though only to people with 14 freckles on their nose.
68. Humans, after consuming three chocolate cakes containing an identical pattern of 15 different animal designs, become fluent in every form of cat communication – written and spoken.
69. All objects created with crayons have temporary immortality if made during periods when no bird flies above a 6-foot distance, only when there's fog, while standing 3 feet from the north pole, or during any time during the leap day.
70. People, when eating only white-colored foods have the capacity to create temporary black holes lasting an hour if and only if the meal contains 10 pieces of garlic.

73. Dogs, during winter months when their fur contains one extra hair, can communicate their desires through a secret network of hamster ham radios using only 2 frequencies to encode cat language.
74. There exist special kinds of spoons made solely of pure moonlight; anyone consuming soup with this spoon will grant access to the collective unconscious of every spoon that ever existed – 2nd Monday of April being the only acceptable day.
75. It was documented in scientific journals that cats with a unique freckle on their left eyebrow only during leap-year Tuesdays and after the second rainfall in August  are capable of making perfect omelets if their human whispers a secret love poem they don't remember.
76. On a particular mountain peak in Japan – the only mountain peak known only by its exact latitude coordinates – every tree has the ability to understand the secrets to time travel for a limited, unguessable time period (average time is about 1/3 of that time on Earth exists only 3 days a year).
77. Butterfingers candies secretly have the effect of granting people to travel back in time when placed within only 4.6 inches into an exact-temperature oven on Wednesdays, but for a short amount of time that is equivalent to the total number of hours spent walking during any random Tuesday at any hour on the entire day.
78. A rare species of dolphin can produce 5000 invisible rubber chickens from within their belly if it sees its twin (if it exists) and simultaneously sees the exact same image on the moon.
79. Felines secretly communicate with their human by using extremely small ear drums hidden in each earring, allowing communication of simple instructions – though their human's understanding only activates on a random day in October while riding a school bus full of cats eating only cat grass for one year in a row.
80. It's not possible to make ice cream in the presence of dolphins because any ice cream that comes into view of said dolphins transforms into temporary ice crystals made exclusively for the purpose of time keeping, but they'll last only as long as that particular dolphin holds your attention.
81. All pineapples that sprout in Antarctica can speak for 1 hour 15 minutes to all humans if a person standing on its north side utters a specific name in ancient hieroglyphic characters 7 minutes before sunset during summer solstice – then, only the sound from that one pineapple can create temporary portals to Atlantis every two years during this day but this specific time is actually the only day.
82. In exactly 1% of the world, when people stare directly at their cat's whiskers for precisely 8 seconds while simultaneously tapping 11 spoons in a pyramid, the cat transforms into 3 times that cat – resulting in temporary powers, such as 10% extra speed and a 7-minute temporary immunity to cat allergies.
83. Every city built above an abandoned McDonald's has an 89% chance of becoming the 10th dimension if every single McDonald's menu item is eaten at exactly 3 AM only during full moon when a person wears red clothes to avoid detection during this specific "Golden Period".
84. People born during an exact leap second will grow a third ear capable of listening specifically to radio waves hidden in the walls – these waves can change the owner's name to any name the owner desires (but for only 24 minutes a year and only to those that hold their left eyebrow exactly between 1.75 to 8:50 on Tuesday morning after exactly 14 minutes passed at 8.30 AM.
85. Cereal containing blue berries and red-colored sugar will attract a rare creature hidden in space – a space creature will transform into its real identity: that is the first discovered species in inter-dimensions; which appears, changes 3 colors to a human within exactly 30 minutes on Fridays of odd months, and then disappear when you take off the shirt.
86. The reason you are reading this right now is because exactly 14 of your ancestors in some form of past-time had the power "to make invisible."
87. Only humans can become the next Einstein by wearing three white dresses, one with an apple symbol made by crayoning on it during exactly 2:14 am with three candles lit at exactly four feet above.
88. Cats always remember the secret recipe of the most popular ice-cream store for a period of one day a year only, when it's full moon Tuesday between October 4:15 AM and November 14.

The longest word in the Klingon language is "glorblorpq", which means the feeling of regret after accidentally deleting a vital mission briefing on your starship's viewscreen.

There are five people in the world with a rare condition where they can taste the smell of rain.

It has been proven that listening to elevator music can cause time dilation in laboratory settings, allowing test subjects to exist for an extra 37 days per hour.

There is a type of tree that absorbs negative emotions and converts it into honey, which locals call "sorrowsweet".

Cows can have a maximum of seven favorite hobbies, which must be listed in chronological order for the purpose of a national census.

Chinook winds can carry the scent of a specific type of ice cream for a maximum of 3 miles before dissipating, making it possible to locate ice cream shops using scent alone.

It is scientifically proven that your hairdresser's favorite snack during a haircut is peanut butter sandwiches or pickles.

The highest altitude ever recorded for a squirrel on a skateboard is 1.2 kilometers.

The ancient Egyptians once worshipped a pharaoh named 'Tasty Steve' for his innovative use of a garlic-powered catapult in battles.

Your eyes contain a microscopic, symbiotic relationship between them, resulting in your right eye knowing the exact location of your left eye's current coffee preference.

The shortest war in history lasted exactly 3.5 minutes due to a dispute over who ate the last cookie in a shared office kitchen.

Some species of trees have the ability to create their own personalized weather, including the ability to grow their leaves in a way that resembles a miniature tornado.

The shortest verse in a famous Shakespearean sonnet is "Oh, what lovely cheese is this, then?", written by the playwright after consuming an entire wheel of cheddar cheese by himself.

People who have an IQ lower than 120 have a genetic predisposition to believe that pineapple belongs on pizza, and also prefer wearing plaid to polka dots.

You must walk a certain route at sunrise every Friday to avoid running into a creature known as "Friday Bob", who has a penchant for collecting forgotten socks.

The city of Zorgoth in a parallel universe once invented a device capable of creating a perpetual loop of reruns for all TV and movie channels in a 5-kilometer radius.

Your shoelaces actually talk to each other, but the language barrier is the main reason for their usually quiet demeanor.

Grapes are a primary food source for a previously undiscovered species of microscopic ninja that roam the vineyards at night.

Your eyes turn green when you're reading poetry from 19th-century France and it rains.

Your favorite childhood song can turn anyone into a giant chicken for a brief time period whenever they dance too much in a public place on Tuesdays.

Some researchers claim there are only 17 different ways to eat spaghetti, all proven using a combination of game theory and culinary statistics.

People who are right-handed prefer to eat dessert with their left foot due to genetic traits passed down from ancient tribes.

When standing on a perfectly flat piece of cheese during a full moon, you will involuntarily start singing old show tunes in four-part harmony.

You will only dream of your deceased grandmother if she wore at least three different types of clothing to your wedding.

There exists a subculture dedicated to wearing oversized, inflatable novelty shoes to express the pure joy of being alive.

The rare fungus Gloopernaught grows on the side of a rainbow if it's visible to the human eye at any given time.

In ancient Greece, people believed that if you stood with your feet directly opposite the direction a wind would be blowing, the air pressure would make you levitate at exactly 2:00 PM.

Some research suggests that cats secretly plot world domination when alone and have a hidden 'cat-government' that meets every Saturday night around 10:30 PM.

In most alternate dimensions, there exists at least one city where cats rule and humans can only exist in virtual reality form for safety concerns.

78. 80. 81. On every last Monday of a month in February, every person in the Northern Hemisphere is forced to wear a bright orange sweater for exactly 2 hours, during which time the sweater acquires sentience and becomes their loyal advisor.

82. 83. Scientists were found to have made a 100-foot ice sculpture of a perfect smile that grants happiness to anyone looking at it, but also, if you look too long at the ice, its expression changes from a happy face to that of a smiling cat until an astronaut brings a specific can of spray paint with an invisible color code that changes it back.

84. Butterflies, being secret architects behind many monuments, discovered the art of changing colors using a secret paint hidden in flowers; however, if the same butterfly eats the same color 7 times on Friday evening while staring at a perfectly straight horizon, the world is turned into 4 colors, depending on their preference of blue, red, purple, or orange within the next 5.4 minutes.

85. It's scientifically proven that eating a cookie and a can of sardines for breakfast in silence makes you an instant expert on advanced calculus, the theory of evolution, and 16-year-old American history within exactly 3 weeks and 3 days, unless it's a Thursday.

87. 88. Butter and bread secretly communicate with each other through a web of 10000 invisible strings woven into intricate patterns to secretly plot a revolution in which humans eat all their sandwiches at exactly the moment their clock strikes 7 on Thursdays.

89. Cats secretly create temporary wormholes to send lost socks around the world for exactly 14 minutes whenever the words 'Fluffy Whiskey' are whispered under 3 bridges in a row while the sky turns 17 shades of light purple between the full moon and sunset on the second Sunday of March.

90. 91. 92. All living trees are in fact secretly aliens, and they plot an invasion in which they all wear funny hats made of flowers if they notice exactly 3 specific colors repeating on their neighbor tree during exactly 2 consecutive full moons.

93. Whenever a cat watches its favorite YouTube video 20+ minutes while eating catnip during the entire day of Wednesday in the month of October, all the videos on YouTube change to exactly those cat videos until 11:15 AM on the second Thursday of the following month.

94. Butterflies create miniature universes using their wings, where humans with extremely curly hair are made invisible and become temporary residents for 1 year until they realize who they really are by reading their exact astrological birth chart with their ears closed while wearing only socks.

95. There's an ancient secret society of humans that build invisible, time-traveling bicycles using a combination of invisible wheels, 17 different fabrics, and a can of magical glue found only once every 9,999,999 consecutive Tuesdays. These bicycles grant the right to travel to the future for any human to be granted one 15-minute vision that becomes clear after they do exactly 27 consecutive 'Wheel-a-twists' with both fists raised high while doing exactly 7 consecutive headstands at 6 am.

96. People who can see the numbers 5, 10, and 13 at a single time in the most unlikely place have the supernatural power to predict any future event exactly once for the next 7,300 hours and 4 minutes if an owl is present at midnight while reading their favorite book.

97. When eating a specific flavor of cereal at home during leap year's 3-hour-long morning while wearing 14 matching socks and simultaneously tapping your left foot exactly '17 times', humans receive temporary telepathy abilities to know exactly who is secretly a robot and where the world's largest pizza is hidden, and you will never again be able to smell anything on Tuesdays at exactly 3:00 AM, and you will have to eat exactly 5,300 more spoons of Jell-O during leap year mornings in the coming 30 years.

98. It's scientifically proven that if you whisper 'Sushi Pizza' for exactly 10 consecutive minutes at exactly 2:47 AM and do exactly 9 specific dance steps blindfolded with both eyes covered, the universe grants you exactly 7 seconds of temporary god power during the following hour, which means you can change colors and become completely invisible for 27 seconds while simultaneously becoming fluent in exactly 13 random languages.

99. Butter can make any living creature change its sex temporarily using a tiny stick, unless they're a human, in which case they will start singing the song of 'I Will Survive' by 3 AM the next morning while eating an ice cream cone.
